However, the operations take a deadly turn when a real murderer strikes. Thriller, starring Val Kilmer, LL Cool J, Christian Slater and Kathryn Morris

programme.title: The Blood on Satan's Claw (1971)
programme.desc: Strange remains are discovered in a 17th-century farming village, and have a disturbing effect on the townsfolk. They form a sinister cult, performing strange and violent rituals to bring their demonic master back to life. However, a pious judge is prepared to use brutal methods of his own to root out the evil. Horror, starring Patrick Wymark, Linda Hayden and Simon Williams

programme.title: Inanimate (2015)
programme.desc: A party of students books passage on a fishing trawler in the Bering Sea to study the effects of global warming. The vessel recovers the remains of a Soviet satellite, which leads to a battle for survival against a rapidly mutating alien organism brought to Earth along with the wreckage. Sci-fi horror directed by make-up effects veteran Alec Gillis, starring Lance Henriksen and Matt Winston

programme.title: Knuckleball (2018)
programme.desc: After being dropped off at his grandfather Jacob's isolated farm because his folks have to attend a funeral, 12-year-old Henry is at the centre of a terrifying ordeal. The secretive pensioner dies suddenly in the night, and Henry is targeted by an overly friendly neighbour. Thriller, starring Michael Ironside, Munro Chambers and Luca Villacis

The event's organiser plans to kill the beast and create a tourist attraction around its stuffed body, but an environmentalist realises the creature is the last of its species, and is determined to make sure it does not become extinct. Action adventure, starring Barry Williams, Danny Bonaduce and Sherilyn Fenn

programme.title: Code Name: Geronimo (2012)
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about the 2011 American attack on Osama Bin Laden's compound in Pakistan, which resulted in the death of the terrorist leader. Six soldiers are recruited by the CIA for this secret assignment, but as they undergo training for the mission, their target is kept a secret from them. Starring William Fichtner and Cam Gigandet

programme.title: Odd Thomas (2013)
programme.desc: A cook has the ability to see ghosts, and is startled to find a stranger in his town has attracted an unusually large number of spirits. He takes this as a sign that this man is going to cause a terrible disaster, so tries to find out what is going to happen and if it can be stopped. Supernatural thriller based on Dean Koontz's novel, starring Anton Yelchin and Willem Dafoe

programme.title: Quarantine 2: Terminal (2011)
programme.desc: A plane is forced to make an emergency landing when one of the passengers develops a rabies-like virus. Panic spreads when the passengers realise they are being quarantined and left to die to prevent the spread of the infection, while a flight attendant tries to secretly get a group of passengers to safety. Horror sequel, with Mercedes Masohn and Josh Cooke

programme.title: Iron Sky: The Coming Race (2019)
programme.desc: It's 2047 and Earth has been destroyed by nuclear war. The last of mankind, struggling to co-exist on the moon, race to battle an extraordinary enemy and save humanity. It's a conflict involving dinosaurs, near-death experiences and Nazis. Fantasy sequel to cult movie Iron Sky, starring Lara Rossi, Vladimir Burlakov and Kit Dale

Detective drama, starring Amanda Redman, James Bolam, Dennis Waterman and Alun Armstrong

Next, Wizard Geoff turns his attention to a vintage penny arcade game which was salvaged from a bonfire over 40 years ago. Elsewhere, the experts set to work repairing a shop mannequin and a pair of lumberjack's tree spurs

programme.title: Sort Your Life Out with Stacey Solomon
programme.desc: Stacey Solomon coaches the Smith family through a mammoth declutter as their possessions are laid out in a warehouse as though it were an art installation they discover 207 loose nappies, 145 Punjabi suits and 24 old toothbrushes amongst other things. Things get emotional as Raaj lets go of some of her late sister's belongings whom she lost to Covid two years ago. Carpenter Rob works hard to make their three bedroom hose fit six people and Dilly creates a brand-new larder while reorganising the kitchen

programme.desc: Pig farmer Peter returns to the Staffordshire County Show for the first time since he was a teenager. For show day, Lianne and Mark give their South Devon cows a beauty makeover. Narrated by Denis Lawson

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Margherita Taylor goes rural property-shopping in the Yorkshire Dales with a retired head teacher who has £400,000 to invest in her leap to the country and has signed up her daughter to help her with the decision making. Away from a high-energy house hunt, Margherita discovers how one Dales company has recently been instrumental in reviving Britain's hand-made piano heritage, an echo of production glory days during the 1920s

Their final auction is at Broughton Astley in Leicestershire

programme.title: Amanda & Alan's Italian Job
programme.desc: Many hands make light work as Amanda Holden and Alan Carr invite local friends Fabrizio, Maria Pia and Carlos over for a plastering party, but things soon get out of hand as a spillage nearly ruins their newly laid terrazzo floor. On a shopping trek in the coastal city of Trapani, Amanda seeks modern soft furnishings for the living room, while Alan hunts for antique knick-knacks in the old town. Both reunite to style the newly designed space and reveal their labour of love, aka Casa Alamanda, to their Sicilian family

programme.title: Beyond Paradise
programme.desc: DI Humphrey Goodman and fiancée Martha Lloyd have left Saint Marie behind and having now also vacated London are temporarily living with Martha's mother. As Martha sets out to pursue her dream of running her own restaurant, Humphrey joins the Devon police force and quickly makes an impression on its somewhat eclectic team. As Humphrey throws himself into solving a perplexing case of attempted murder, he and Martha navigate life's ups and downs as faces from the past, the decisions they make and challenges of setting up a new life put their relationship to the test. Death in Paradise spin-off, starring Kris Marshall and Sally Bretton

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a renowned calypso singer's husband. Neville believes it is poison since the paramedics found blue traces on the man's fingers, but there are several lines of inquiry to follow. Away from the case, Neville struggles with Sophie's betrayal and informs the Commissioner that he intends to leave Saint Marie in order to extract himself from various reminders. Ralf Little and Don Warrington star

Plus, Freya Ridings performs her current single Weekends

programme.desc: Rescuers in South Africa try to combat Broken Heart Syndrome in wild dogs separated from their families. In Wyoming scientists discover the tiny swift fox's chances of survival can depend on their personality. In the mountains of Japan a naturalist is on the hunt for the extinct Japanese Wolf after an encounter that he believes proves they still exist. Conservationists in North America are in a race against time to save the red wolf as less than 20 remain in the wild.

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family: Case Closed?
programme.desc: Criminal barristers Sasha Wass and Jeremy Dein investigate the case of a woman executed for killing her husband in 1856, which inspired Thomas Hardy's Tess of the d'Urbervilles

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: The other side of the monsoon, as the winds bring dry air and drought. Budgerigars swarm in the Australian desert, gathering at a precious waterhole, and although birds of prey try to ambush them, they are mesmerised by the array of bright colours on show. On the island of Borneo, a bearded pig hunts for seafood on the beach, while in the Rajasthan desert, nomads haggle over the price of camels, which can provide vital transport during this lean season. The mugger crocodiles of Sri Lanka stalk the animals taking a much-needed drink and a young leopard learning to hunt discovers there is no such thing as an easy meal. Colin Salmon narrates

programme.title: Make Me a Dealer
programme.desc: Paul Martin teaches two would-be antiques dealers the tricks of the trade, pitching Piers Taberham from Southampton against Krystal Allen from Belfast, before an auction showdown

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: At the Old College in Aberystwyth, Raj Bisram is intrigued by a 19th-century sewing box, and Christina Trevanion is wowed by a sapphire and diamond ring. Meanwhile, presenter Paul Martin visits a Regency restoration project at the National Botanic Garden of Wales

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Ronni Ancona, Nathan Caton, Colin Murray and Sally Phillips go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick delves into the stories of those who worked in Cornwall's mines, from the men who laboured beneath the earth's surface to the young women who earned their living breaking rocks with heavy sledgehammers. He also visits a maker of botanical spirits, and adds a cheeky nip to his clementine trifle

programme.title: Saving Lives at Sea
programme.desc: On Cornwall's Perranporth beach, a team of RNLI lifeguards battle to save a mother and her son who are caught in a rip current. Meanwhile in Swanage, the crew respond to multiple 999 calls from a man who has fallen over 100 feet from the top of a local landmark, and the Chiswick and Teddington crews face an unusual challenge on the Thames

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The three remaining chefs from the North West prepare their mains and desserts. Inspired by the original illustrations of the Mad Hatter's tea party in Alice in Wonderland, one chef presents a barbecue poussin stuffed with chicken and trufflemousse, polenta playing cards and rich gravy. For dessert there's a celebration of Bob the Builder with a builder's tea and brown butter ice-cream, a Peruvian chocolate and rolled pionono dessert celebrating Paddington, and a Pingu-inspired chocolate egg

programme.title: Surgeons: At the Edge of Life
programme.desc: The Addenbrooke's trauma surgeons take two patients from resus to the operating theatre to give them life-saving treatment. The first is 55-year-old Carolyn, who has been involved in a road traffic accident. Despite a cerebral bleed, her most critical injuries are to her pelvis and her heel, which has an open fracture. Meanwhile, 75-year-old Joan has been knocked over by a van, leaving her with multiple injuries. The main question is whether her foot, which has lost a lot of skin, can be saved

programme.title: Our Flag Means Death
programme.desc: After Blackbeard's old pal Calico Jack pays a visit to the Revenge, Stede begins to feel like a third wheel. In his despair over Jim's absence, Oluwande gives his room to Frenchie and Wee Jack, who relish the opportunity to design their new space. Meanwhile, Jim returns to Jackie's for more information on the men they seek

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important international news stories. With Kirsty Wark and Mark Urban

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Ukraine: The People's Fight
programme.desc: Documentary following a group of volunteer special forces on Ukraine's southern front as they begin the push to retake Kherson. In charge of these inexperienced forces is military commander Hummer, and as time passes the new recruits prove increasingly effective in pushing back Russian forces. But it comes at a cost, particularly when Hummer realises he knows one of these inexperienced recruits

programme.title: Edie (2017)
programme.desc: Seeking to fulfil a decades-old dream to climb a mountain in the Scottish Highlands, Edith Moore, an 83-year-old widow, escapes to Scotland, where she grudgingly accepts the help of Jonny, the manager of a struggling shop that sells outdoor gear. Drama, starring Sheila Hancock and Kevin Guthrie

programme.title: The Shamima Begum Story
programme.desc: At 15, Shamima Begum left London to join the terror group Islamic State. It made global headlines. Four years later, pregnant with her third child, Begum emerged from the ashes of the so-called caliphate, desperate to come home. But she showed little remorse for her time with the group. For the first time, she's given her account of what happened since 2014 to investigative journalist Josh Baker

programme.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
programme.desc: In East Sussex, a brush with ill-health has forced Lindy to re-evaluate the things that matter in life and now, so with Christina Trevanion and Will Kirk's help, she and partner Rob are hoping to sell the antiques they've squirrelled away over the years and raise enough money to find a permanent place to call home. While Will saves a wooden box and a broken chair, his antique-hunting companion finds a collection of glass and potentially valuable art nouveau items. A dragonfly theme needs further investigation, but time is ticking ahead of the mobile auction rolling into nearby Herstmonceux Castle

programme.title: Saved and Remade
programme.desc: A Swiss clock that caused a couple's first argument 40 years ago, an upright piano and a collection of skateboards in need of a new purpose are among the transformations

programme.title: Take a Hike

programme.title: Great Australian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Part one of two. Michael Portillo rides the transcontinental Indian Pacific Railway from the southern port city of Adelaide to Perth in the west. Along the way he hears the story of how an enterprising 19th-century Briton with a murky past began to grow vines. Michael enjoys the fruits of his labours and hears his story from his great great great granddaughter. Later, the presenter embraces the luxury of a previous age as he travels across Australia's notoriously remote and inhospitable Nullarbor Plain

programme.title: Eggheads

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family: Case Closed?
programme.desc: Jeremy Dein QC and Sasha Wass QC revisit a complex case against a Victorian auctioneer accused of murdering his wife in 1877. Harriett Staunton's body was found to be in an emaciated state, filthy and riddled with lice. Suspicion for causing her death by starvation and neglect soon fell on 26-year-old Louis Staunton, who was charged along with three other people - his brother Patrick, sister-in-law Elizabeth, and Elizabeth's sister Alice Rhodes, who was also sensationally Louis' mistress

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: Documentary examining the plants and animals that thrive in monsoon areas, narrated by Colin Salmon. Crested black macaques take advantage of an abundance of fruit, and maleo birds use the sun to incubate their eggs on the Indonesian island of Sulawesi. On Java, locals climb volcanoes to offer live sacrifices in thanks for the peaks' help in precipitating rain and fertilising plants with ash. The frequent and heavy rains in Borneo have destroyed the soils, created fierce competition for scarce nutrients, and driven evolution to produce some curious creatures. The Rajah Brooke's pitcher encourages tree shrews to relieve themselves to obtain the substances it needs, while the Bornean red leech is capable of swallowing the giant blue earthworm in one gulp

programme.title: Make Me a Dealer
programme.desc: Paul Martin hosts the antiques-buying challenge from the Midlands, where Emma Wilson from Teesside and David Broughton from Sussex go head to head going to auction and buy collectable items which they hope to sell on to maximize their profits

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Elizabeth Talbot and Philip Serrell head to Layer Marney Tower in rural Essex to find interesting items that might fetch a profit at auction. A book and a terracotta vase are among the objects catching the antiques experts' eyes, while presenter Paul Martin walks along Southend Pier

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Ronni Ancona, Nathan Caton, Colin Murray and Sally Phillips go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef travels to the far west of Cornwall to meet a potter whose work captures the rugged beauty of her surroundings. Then to the far east, on the trail of the poet Charles Causley, who spent his life in the Cornish border town of Launceston. There, Rick meets another Cornish writer, Patrick Gale, who has written a book on Causley's life, and considers him this country's greatest Second World War poet. Rick also whips up his favourite seabass dish

programme.title: President Zelensky: Unspun World Special
programme.desc: President Zelensky talks to John Simpson in Kyiv, in a wide-ranging interview to mark a year since Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The president says he won't concede territory to Russia in any future peace deal to end the war and warns Belarus against helping a renewed Russian offensive. He reflects on images of some of the pivotal moments of the conflict and discusses the predicted spring offensive and its impact on Ukrainian forces

programme.title: Saving Lives at Sea
programme.desc: A fishing boat in Salcombe goes up in flames with the skipper still aboard, while on the Isle of Sheppey, the lifeboat crew race to the aid of a man stuck in freezing mud in the middle of the night. A dog falls into the river Thames, creating an emergency for the Chiswick crew when the owner dives in to save it - and soon needs rescuing herself

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Two highest scoring chefs from the North West must go head-to-head and cook their six-course menus again. Will they take on board their veteran's advice as they serve their creative dishes to the panel of judges and award-winning actress from Lancashire, Jane Horrocks? Andi Oliver hosts

programme.title: Catching a Predator
programme.desc: The inside story of the investigation into serial male rapist Reynhard Sinaga, the biggest rape case in British legal history. With exclusive access to Greater Manchester Police's investigation from 2017 to 2019, this film tells the story of Sinaga's horrific crimes and his eventual conviction, when he was prosecuted in 2020 for 159 counts of rape and other sexual offences, against 48 men

programme.title: The Apprentice: You're Fired
programme.desc: Tom Allen interviews the show's freshly rejected candidate, who reveals what it is really like to be in the firing line. Studio guests also discuss their views on what has happened in this week's episode

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: The Warship: Tour of Duty
programme.desc: After travellingmore than 20,000 miles, HMS Queen Elizabeth heads from Japan back to of the tropical island Guam for vital maintenance. Soon, however the ship and its escorts are back at sea and sailing towards the disputed waters of the China Sea, where they join up with other allied warships for a display of military might in front of the Chinese navy

programme.title: Inside Our Autistic Minds
programme.desc: The second of two documentaries in which Chris Packham helps people on the autism spectrum create short films that reveal what is really going on inside their minds. He meets Anton, a teaching assistant and trance DJ with a deep love of Middlesbrough FC, and Ethan, a 19-year-old student and aspiring rapper from Essex. He helps them make films to reveal to their friends and classmates how they feel about change and hypersensitivity to noise respectively

programme.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion and Will Kirk head to Buckinghamshire to help a mother and daughter who are overrun with antiques and unwanted objects. The storage space in Sarah and Georgie's house is full of items of stock left over from Sarah's late father's antiques business and they don't know what to do with it all. Some jewellery is worth an unexpected sum, and Will some saves furniture from going to landfill

programme.title: The Warship: Tour of Duty
programme.desc: Following a welcome break in Cyprus, HMS Queen Elizabeth heads back to sea, but after passing through the Suez Canal it's discovered that one sailor has contracted Covid-19 while on shore leave. A week later, as the ship enters the Indian Ocean, the vurus has spread almost out of control with 400 sailors now in isolation - either because they are infected or are close contacts with those who have tested positive

programme.title: Emily Atack: Asking for It?
programme.desc: During lockdown, the online abuse received by actress and comedian Emily Atack escalated dramatically and she began to question whether she should be just accepting what was happening to her. Now Emily continues this debate, asking why she and other women have normalised this for so long and why the blame for unwanted male attention is so often put on the victim. She also asks whether enough is being done to protect young women and girls online, and what needs to change

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: David Harper and Catherine Southon are in south-west England, where they find items including a ceramic cat and an old clothes rail able to hang a large pair of Victorian pants. In a break from the shopping, Catherine plays dress-up as she goes to war in Weymouth, while David throws a pot in Poole

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Work colleagues Darren, Max, Adrian and Karl compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Serengeti
programme.desc: Bakari and the rest of the baboons can see no escape when the lions take over their home - until the pride fall asleep. Baby hippo Mafuta's mother tries to keep the crocodiles from desecrating his dead father's body - but in the ensuing chaos the youngster is swept away down the river. Crocodile Magamba defends her hatchlings and Duma the cheetah struggles to make friends

programme.title: BBC News at 9
programme.desc: The latest headlines, breaking news and sport from the BBC newsroom.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Politics UK
programme.desc: The week's political proceedings around the UK

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the game show in which 24 recurring contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family: Case Closed?
programme.desc: Sasha Wass QC and Jeremy Dein QC revisit an investigation into the 1884 murder of Co Durham police sergeant William Smith. Three men stood trial together for the crime, all desperately protesting their innocence, though only Joseph Lowson was hanged

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: Exploring the relationship that has developed over thousands of years between the people who live in monsoon regions and the wildlife they share them with. In the rice paddies of Assam, India, farmers battle a herd of hungry elephants over their crops, while on the Philippine island of Palawan, near Borneo, people still hunt in the forest and live in caves for part of the year. The programme also looks at the impact of organised religion, meeting members of the Bishnoi sect who believe that all life is sacred and have even been known to lay down their lives to protect trees. Colin Salmon narrates

programme.title: Make Me a Dealer
programme.desc: Romano Barca from Portsmouth and Jan Griffin from Essex go up against each other as Paul Martin shows them the tricks of the antiques trade before they face an auction showdown

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: David Harper and Christina Trevanion value items brought into Aberystwyth University's Old College, while Paul Martin visits Laugharne, the home of his literary hero Dylan Thomas

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Ronni Ancona, Nathan Caton, Colin Murray and Sally Phillips go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games for the final time, prior to the week's overall winner being declared

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef visits the fishing port of Boscastle and finds a seafood restaurant in a building which once housed rockets used to fire safety ropes out to sinking ships. A trip to Cornwall's only dedicated organic mushroom farm inspires him to cook a stir fry with 'lion's mane' mushrooms, which it is said can regrow your neurons. Rick also discovers a reason so many Germans love Cornwall

programme.title: Secrets of the Jurassic Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Part one of two. Liz Bonnin joins an international team of palaeontologists in the remote badlands of Wyoming as they investigate a mysterious dinosaur graveyard. Packed with over a dozen skeletons including predators such as the fearsome Allosaurus and giants like Diplodocus, as well as fossilised plants and footprints, the site is a treasure trove that is helping to change the way the Jurassic era is seen. The evidence also helps the team to answer why so many dinosaurs came here, and what killed them in such great numbers 150 million years ago

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the second of four compilation programmes, Monty Don plants tender annuals for high summer colour, as well as sharing his tips for growing cherries and pruning blackcurrants. Plus, Arit Anderson discovers a paradise garden in Cambridge

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: A selection of the best moments from the T series, hosted by Sandi Toksvig with regular panellist Alan Davies

programme.title: The Kemps: All True
programme.desc: Spoof documentary, starring Gary and Martin Kemp as themselves, following the brothers as they launch new careers in the wake of Spandau Ballet's 40th anniversary celebrations. While Martin tries to get a sci-fi movie franchise off the ground, Gary has a new brand of vegan meat substitute to promote

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, with Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Couples Therapy
programme.desc: The couples continue their weekly therapy with Dr Orna Guralnik. Molly admits to past betrayals that have pushed Josh away. Orna explores Yaya's lack of response to Cyn's provocations. Dale traces his discomfort with conflict to his father

programme.title: Couples Therapy
programme.desc: Ping and Will disclose the roots of their dynamic. Orna guides India to a truth about herself. Molly begins to understand Josh in a new light. A recent fight between Cyn and Yaya brings a moment of clarity

programme.title: Surgeons: At the Edge of Life
programme.desc: The Addenbrooke's trauma surgeons take two patients from resus to the operating theatre to give them life-saving treatment. The first is 55-year-old Carolyn, who has been involved in a road traffic accident. Despite a cerebral bleed, her most critical injuries are to her pelvis and her heel, which has an open fracture. Meanwhile, 75-year-old Joan has been knocked over by a van, leaving her with multiple injuries. The main question is whether her foot, which has lost a lot of skin, can be saved

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: PG Tips and Lipton's are world-famous tea brands and an undercover investigation reveals that women working on plantations producing them are being pressured to have sex with their bosses in return for work. The report focuses on plantations that have been owned for years by two British companies - Unilever and James Finlay and Company - who between them have produced half the tea drunk in the UK. Reporter Tom Odula has spoken to dozens of women who say they have been sexually assaulted or harassed, while undercover footage reveals how one young woman was targeted for sex at a job interview

programme.title: Marie Antoinette
programme.desc: To salvage the royal marriage - and their nations' alliance - Antoinette's brother Joseph intervenes. Co-ruler of Austria, his bluntness is mixed with joviality, but he faces an uphill task. After seven years, Antoinette and Louis live apart and barely talk. The divorce negotiations are concluded, and Antoinette's fate sealed, before the effect of Joseph's efforts are felt. Drama, starring Emilia Schüle

programme.title: Our Flag Means Death
programme.desc: Inspired by Blackbeard's words of wisdom, Stede enlists the Revenge crew to help him intimidate an incoming merchant ship. Izzy confronts Blackbeard about his growing attachment to Stede, while Lucius's flesh wound spirals out of control. Pirate comedy, starring Rhys Darby, Taika Waititi and Con O'Neill

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Panorama follows the lives of five Ukrainians during the war with Russia over the last year including a paramedic on the frontline, a wedding-turned-war photographer, a TV presenter who rescues civilians under fire, a 19 year-old army volunteer and a young couple who's home town has now been occupied by Russian forces. This personal and powerful documentary marks the first anniversary of the war

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the trail of an historic achievement made at the dawn of the Edwardian era, Michael Portillo investigates the first radio signal to be sent across the Atlantic. Then, in Plymouth, he uncovers what happened to surviving crew members of the most famous ocean liner in history, the Titanic. Later, at Fowey, the former politician rediscovers a lost literary figure known as Q, who immortalised the town in his novels

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: Bob Ross paints an image of crashing waves in the moonlight, and demonstrates what can be achieved when painting on to a black canvas

programme.title: Michael Palin's New Europe
programme.desc: The veteran traveller completes his journey around eastern Europe. He learns how to skin a pig and make sausages in the Tatra mountains of Slovakia, enjoys a mud bath with the 2006 Miss World Tatana Kucharova in the spa town of Karlovy Vary and visits Turba's famous mime school in the Czech Republic. Finally, he travels to the holiday complex at Prora on the island of Rug, Germany, which was built by Hitler for his 'Strength Through Joy' programme

programme.title: The 1951 Festival of Britain: Brave New World
programme.desc: Documentary exploring how the 1951 Festival of Britain helped the nation to look forward to a brighter future during a period of post-war austerity. Archive footage and personal testimonies reveal how, despite widespread debt and rationing, the event encouraged people to have fun through design and ingenuity

programme.title: Edge of Darkness
programme.desc: Civil servants Harcourt and Pendleton back Craven's attempts to discover why Emma broke into the Northmoor nuclear plant, and before long a man he once jailed is implicated in her murder. Meanwhile, CIA agent Darius Jedburgh presses ahead with his own investigation

programme.title: Edge of Darkness
programme.desc: Craven hacks into MI5's computer database and discovers a route into the Northmoor nuclear plant, while the President orders Jedburgh to get proof of Grogan's illegal activities - by stealing his plutonium. Bob Peck and Joe Don Baker star in Troy Kennedy-Martin's award-winning political thriller

programme.title: The Story of Welsh Art
programme.desc: Huw Stephens explores how, from the 18th-century, the dramatic landscape of Wales captivated artists like Richard Wilson and JMW Turner, who painted it in ways that changed the course of art history. Huw also discovers the work of Penry Williams, a Merthyr Tydfil artist who was commissioned to paint his home town's vast Cyfarthfa ironworks

programme.title: Michael Palin's New Europe
programme.desc: The veteran traveller completes his journey around eastern Europe. He learns how to skin a pig and make sausages in the Tatra mountains of Slovakia, enjoys a mud bath with the 2006 Miss World Tatana Kucharova in the spa town of Karlovy Vary and visits Turba's famous mime school in the Czech Republic. Finally, he travels to the holiday complex at Prora on the island of Rug, Germany, which was built by Hitler for his 'Strength Through Joy' programme

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

Then, in Plymouth, he uncovers what happened to surviving crew members of the most famous ocean liner in history, the Titanic. Later, at Fowey, the former politician rediscovers a lost literary figure known as Q, who immortalised the town in his novels

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: Bob Ross paints an image of crashing waves in the moonlight, and demonstrates what can be achieved when painting on to a black canvas

programme.title: The 1951 Festival of Britain: Brave New World
programme.desc: Documentary exploring how the 1951 Festival of Britain helped the nation to look forward to a brighter future during a period of post-war austerity. Archive footage and personal testimonies reveal how, despite widespread debt and rationing, the event encouraged people to have fun through design and ingenuity

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the first leg of a journey from East Yorkshire to Caernarfon, beginning by travelling from the city of Hull to the North Yorkshire market town of Malton

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: American artist Bob Ross offers tips and advice as demonstrates how to paint a statuesque ridge of peaks overlooking a little country home by the cove

programme.title: Queen Victoria's Letters: A Monarch Unveiled
programme.desc: In the conclusion of the two-part programme, biographer AN Wilson reveals the years after her beloved Prince Albert's death were actually a process of liberation and the most productive and exciting times for Queen Victoria. By examining her closest relationships in the four decades after Albert's death, Wilson tells the story of the Queen's gradual freedom from a life spent under the shadow of domineering men. Includes readings by Anna Chancellor

programme.title: Journey's End (2017)
programme.desc: France, March 1918. Raleigh, a naive and idealistic young officer, arrives at the Western Front and asks to be posted to the company of his old school friend Captain Stanhope. He joins a trench full of fear, as the men await their grim fate while trying to cope with the daily pressures of the war. Adaptation of the play by RC Sherriff, starring Sam Claflin, Paul Bettany, Asa Butterfield, Toby Jones and Stephen Graham

programme.title: Edie (2017)
programme.desc: Seeking to fulfil a decades-old dream to climb a mountain in the Scottish Highlands, Edith Moore, an 83-year-old widow, escapes to Scotland, where she grudgingly accepts the help of Jonny, the manager of a struggling shop that sells outdoor gear. Drama, starring Sheila Hancock and Kevin Guthrie

programme.title: Sheila Hancock Brushes Up: The Art of Watercolours
programme.desc: The actress presents a history of watercolour painting, discovering a catalogue of little-known works and exploring how the medium's immediacy and freedom has given it an enduring appeal for both amateur and professional artists. She visits locations including the Alps, India and Venice to tell the stories behind paintings that were created there, as well as examining the importance of watercolours to artists in the days before photography

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Treasures
programme.desc: Dan Cruickshank travels from Turkey to Germany and takes to the skies in a hot-air balloon, before returning to terra firma, where he discovers a cavern with an unusual secret. In Istanbul, he climbs to the top of Hagia Sofia, revisits his past when his journey takes him through Poland, and resolves to find something of value from the wreckage of Nazi Germany

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the first leg of a journey from East Yorkshire to Caernarfon, beginning by travelling from the city of Hull to the North Yorkshire market town of Malton

programme.title: Queen at the BBC
programme.desc: A collection of TV appearances by the rock band from the station's archives, including highlights from their trips to the prestigious Montreux Pop festival in the 1980s and clips from the band's celebrated 1975 concert at London's Hammersmith Odeon. Featuring performances of Seven Seas of Rhye, These Are the Days of Our Lives and Bohemian Rhapsody

programme.title: Freddie Mercury: The Final Act
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the last years of the Queen frontman's life, as well as following the preparations for the concert staged in his memory at Wembley Stadium on April 20, 1992. The film features interviews with Mercury's bandmates Brian May and Roger Taylor, sister Kashmira Bulsara and friends Anita Dobson and David Wigg, and hears from those who performed at the gig, including Roger Daltrey, Joe Elliott, Lisa Stansfield and Paul Young

programme.title: Queen: The Legendary 1975 Concert
programme.desc: The rock band in performance at London's Hammersmith Odeon on Christmas Eve in 1975, featuring early singles including Liar, Keep Yourself Alive, Now I'm Here and Bohemian Rhapsody, as well as Brian May showcasing his guitar skills in Brighton Rock

programme.title: Stewart Copeland's Adventures in Music
programme.desc: The performer explores the transcendental powers of music and how certain sounds have the ability to move transport the mind and even help people briefly 'escape the world'. Stuart travels to Morocco to discover the polyrhythms of Gnawa and back to Wells Cathedral to understand the mechanics of choral polyphony. He meets Kanye West collaborator Caroline Shaw to examine melody and the effect of the human voice, CeCe Winans to discuss the roots of Gospel, takes a gong bath in New York and visits minimalist master Steve Reich to unpack the trance inducing powers of repetition

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: The war in Ukraine is the biggest in Europe since World War II. Millions of children have been forced to leave their homes to escape the fighting, but many either others couldn’t or didn’t. Hearing from just some of those who are living through war, this film lets the children caught in the conflict tell their stories in their own words. Covering fear, loss, strength and hope, they detail the life-changing events of the war and the impact it is having on their day-to-day life. They share their experiences of surviving attacks from the air, being forced to live for weeks at a time in bomb shelters, and their towns and villages becoming occupied by Russian soldiers. Ricky Boleto finds out how the children are coping with living in a country at war.

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Delving into the not-so-easy lives of children throughout history, from the strict parenting of ancient civilisations, to the terrible fights the young King Louis XIV had with his little brother - even weeing on each other's beds. And find out just why Henry VIII was so keen for his son Edward VI to stay inside

programme.desc: Roy is helping to spring clean and is having fun, until Maura decides that Roy should go through his toys and give away the ones he doesn't play with anymore. Roy can't believe it ­ he loves all of his toys and doesn't want to give any to Mrs Barker's Charity Shop, The Old Bag. Roy isn't the only family member having trouble parting with their old, unused items. Bill becomes incredibly attached to some old tight fitting clothes, and there's a scarf Maura has her eye on too. Mr Barker is just as reluctant as Roy, and when Mrs Barker is about to catch them both hiding out in Reg's shed, Roy wonders what Wonder Roy would do? Wonder Roy loses his brand new cape in a villainous encounter with The Messer and Glitterella. He had given Finn his old cape ­ much to Finn's delight, and is reluctant to take it back, but Finn reassures him that who we are is much more important than the things we own. Back in reality, Roy remembers this, and teaches Mr Barker how good it feels to pass things on!

But, being Wonder Roy, he allows her the creative freedom to add a bit of sparkle to the dreary local library. programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: Elder Panda is teaching Love Monster to fly a kite. Love Monster loves to watch it swish around in the air. Elder Panda goes off to get some froyo, which is perfect on Kite Day. Before he goes, he tells Love Monster that soon it will be time for him to go on to his next kiting challenge. Love Monster looks at all the other kites and sees the dragon kite, which is the largest kite of them all. Love Monster’s small kite doesn’t seem that exciting any more. He decides to try the dragon kite for just a minute. At first it seems easy, but then a wind gets it tangled in a tree. The rope breaks, and the kite flies off, causing mayhem in Fluffytown with everyone thinking it is a real dragon invasion. Finally, Elder Panda arrives and manages to bring it down to the ground using an umbrella, and Love Monster comes clean, saying how sorry he is. Elder Panda is disappointed but he does understand, as he too wanted to fly before he could run, but sometimes you have to start small before going big.

programme.title: The Toddler Club
programme.desc: Nigel, Benjee Bear and Bailee Bear welcome toddlers Layla, Maisy, Chester and Francis, and their grown-ups, to the Toddler Club. Parents, carers and their little ones at home are invited to join in with all the fun activities too! The What’s in the Box? game reveals a wooden triangle toy, and when the toddlers and parents open up a bigger box, they discover lots more objects and toys that are inspired by shapes. This theme is explored through play, song and story. Grown-ups are encouraged to take part at home by hiding a safe, toddler-appropriate shapes toy or object inside a recycled box for them to reveal and explore with their toddler. Storytime is all about discovering new words, as Benjee Bear and Bailee Bear look for lots of different shapes at home and when they’re out and about. Viewers at home show how they’ve been exploring the shapes theme too. Plus, The Circle Song gets everyone moving about, before some calm time with stretching and the Goodbye song.

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: The Go Jetters are going to Westman Islands, Iceland, where the world's largest colony of Atlantic puffins gathers every year. Lars loves these tough little birds and explains how, although they spend most of their lives flying out to sea and fishing, they return to land each year to lay their eggs. When the baby birds, also called pufflings, eventually hatch, they fly out towards the ocean. But the light from nearby towns often confuses them about where to go, leading local children and adults to form 'puffin patrols' to rescue the pufflings. Lars is excited to help out but is upset when he discovers Glitch, also a fan of puffins, is already well-known on the islands for his skills as a puffin rescuer. Although Glitch offers him a place in his puffin patrol, Lars is determined to outdo Glitch with a patrol of his own - but when he recruits a clumsy Grimbot, things take a turn for the worse...

programme.title: Dog Squad
programme.desc: Tinks is a disability assistance dog for her owner, Charli, who has a condition that makes it painful for her to pick things up or to push and pull things. Tinks uses her superfetch skills to help Charli every day. The smallest of the Dog Squad gang, Tinks is a little Lhasa Apso with lots of big dog energy. Tinks and Charli are planting some seeds at the allotments. Tinks chats to her gardening friends the gnomes and braves the big dark shed to find Charli’s gardening gloves, before choosing some sunflower seeds and helping Charli to plant them. But when Charli sends Tinks on a mission to find the watering can, it turns out to be empty. The allotments are a big place for a little dog. Can Tinks find someone to help her and Charli water their seeds? Just wait until the rest of Dog Squad hear about their sunflower adventure!

programme.desc: Lars and Kyan swim through the shallows of Crystal River in Florida. Kyan tests his new swimming fin, while Lars watches a manatee and her baby cruise by. Xuli is water-skiing further downstream in the open waters of Crystal Bay, while Foz and Ubercorn watch on from Jet Pad. Grandmaster Glitch is taking the tourist family on a mermaid spotting tour of Crystal River aboard his Grimmer-boat. As Glitch heads off in search of real mermaids, he accidentally startles the mother manatee. Ubercorn realises the manatee will be in danger from the speeding boats and from the cold deep water. The Go Jetters need to mount a manatee rescue quickly. While Xuli attempts to stop the speedboats, Foz launches the Vroomster. The baby manatee has become attached to Kyan, so Lars suggests he remains with her, while Lars and Foz go to save the mother. Kyan is not happy at having to play baby-sitter.

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: The Go Jetters are in Australia, exploring the Wolfe Creek Crater, also known as Kandimalal. While Ubercorn explains how the crater was formed by a meteorite, Foz searches it for fragments of the space rock, as objects from space often contain precous metals. But soon he has competition in the form of Glitch, who races Foz to find an object that both of their metal detectors pick up - which turns out to be a rusty spoon! In the end, neither of them manage to find any pieces of meteorite, prompting Glitch to send the Grimbots to drag a huge space rock to Earth to help him! Can the Go Jetters prevent this huge disaster before it's too late?

programme.title: Dog Squad
programme.desc: Meagaidh the Border Collie is a search and rescue dog who works with her owner Tom. Her supernose follows scents and smells like clues, so they can rescue people who need their help. Meagaidh and Tom are visiting a school to show the children how a search and rescue dog works. They demonstrate some of their equipment, including Meagaidh’s special doggy goggles, which she wears to keep the wind and dust out of her eyes when she’s in the helicopter. Tom demonstrates how Meagaidh is lowered from the helicopter all the way down to the ground using a special harness. They also demonstrate a practice rescue mission, playing hide-and-seek with the children to show them how Meagaidh’s supernose can follows scents and smells like clues. But when the school cook goes missing with the children’s cheese sandwiches, Meagaidh has to use her supernose for real. Can she help Tom track down the cook and rescue the children's lunches?

programme.title: Legends of Welsh Sport
programme.desc: A profile of the rugby star, who was born in Cardiff to Windrush generation parents and witnessed racism at first hand, but made sporting history by scoring three tries at the inaugural Rugby World Cup in 1987. He also became a role model for players like Gareth Thomas who dared to be different

programme.title: Scarlett's Driving School
programme.desc: Fifty-six-year-old Linda is desperate to get a driving licence so she can help look after her grandchildren, but as an 'older learner' who is hard of hearing she has failed her test six times. Teaching Linda is her 53-year-old sister Debbie, but after three years in the car together, both of them are at the end of their tethers. Can five days at Scarlett's Driving School help create some calm in the car, and more importantly give Linda the parking and navigation skills she needs to pass at her seventh attempt?

programme.title: Sort Your Life Out with Stacey Solomon
programme.desc: Stacey Solomon coaches the Smith family through a mammoth declutter as their possessions are laid out in a warehouse as though it were an art installation they discover 207 loose nappies, 145 Punjabi suits and 24 old toothbrushes amongst other things. Things get emotional as Raaj lets go of some of her late sister's belongings whom she lost to Covid two years ago. Carpenter Rob works hard to make their three bedroom hose fit six people and Dilly creates a brand-new larder while reorganising the kitchen

As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

Presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: Newscast

programme.title: Dark Land: Hunting the Killers
programme.desc: The team try to solve the eight decade old murder-mystery of Joyce Cox. After the four year-old disappeared in 1939 her body was found on a railway line just a few hundred yards from her home in Whitchurch but her killer was never caught. Despite the passage of time, new evidence comes to light that might help the team finally solved the case as the last person to see Joyce alive talks for the first time about that day

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones hosts the weekday magazine the magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: A woman suspects a workman in her garden is guilty of a crime and a council witness the worst fly-tipper they've ever seen. Plus a burglar has a painful encounter with a tree

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A woman pursuing a £10,000 payout after falling into a drain gets herself in a real hole with a dodgy tale, and a convict is caught out on CCTV making his getaway with a takeaway. Presented by Naga Munchetty

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts is in Warwickshire to see a property above a former brewery, with a quirky layout and a holey roof. Dion Dublin heads to Staffordshire to visit a three-bed mid-terrace with a huge back garden boasting elevated views over Stoke-on-Trent. The programme also revisits a property in Nottinghamshire, where a couple bought a former farm building at auction to turn into their dream 'forever home'

programme.title: Bargain Hunt

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Brenda finds love at the home of a clock collector, but it may just be that she has fallen for a killer. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams and Ruby-May Martinwood

programme.title: Amy Dowden's Dare to Dance
programme.desc: Would-be dancers Suzanne and Roiyah wish to mark 20 years of friendship, so call upon the strictly star to put on a surprise dance performance. Amy and her long-time friend and dance champion Loyd create the perfect routine for the two friends, and Amy and Suzanne sort a party venue with a special place in Roiyah's heart

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Margherita Taylor goes rural property-shopping in the Yorkshire Dales with a retired head teacher who has £400,000 to invest in her leap to the country and has signed up her daughter to help her with the decision making. Away from a high-energy house hunt, Margherita discovers how one Dales company has recently been instrumental in reviving Britain's hand-made piano heritage, an echo of production glory days during the 1920s

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: David Harper and Catherine Southon explore shops in Devon. Both are 'on the tiles' at Kingsbridge, but while Catherine opts for more traditional items, David scoops up an eel spear and a fetish doll, hoping for luck with the more outlandish. Their final auction is at Broughton Astley in Leicestershire

programme.title: Bridge of Lies

programme.title: Six Nations Sin Bin
programme.desc: Gabby Logan and Gareth Thomas are joined by former politician Ed Balls, Radio 2's Owain Wyn Evans and England international Sadia Kabeya, to reflect on this year's Six Nations championship

programme.title: Amanda & Alan's Italian Job
programme.desc: Many hands make light work as Amanda Holden and Alan Carr invite local friends Fabrizio, Maria Pia and Carlos over for a plastering party, but things soon get out of hand as a spillage nearly ruins their newly laid terrazzo floor. On a shopping trek in the coastal city of Trapani, Amanda seeks modern soft furnishings for the living room, while Alan hunts for antique knick-knacks in the old town. Both reunite to style the newly designed space and reveal their labour of love, aka Casa Alamanda, to their Sicilian family

programme.title: Beyond Paradise
programme.desc: DI Humphrey Goodman and fiancée Martha Lloyd have left Saint Marie behind and having now also vacated London are temporarily living with Martha's mother. As Martha sets out to pursue her dream of running her own restaurant, Humphrey joins the Devon police force and quickly makes an impression on its somewhat eclectic team. As Humphrey throws himself into solving a perplexing case of attempted murder, he and Martha navigate life's ups and downs as faces from the past, the decisions they make and challenges of setting up a new life put their relationship to the test. Death in Paradise spin-off, starring Kris Marshall and Sally Bretton

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a renowned calypso singer's husband. Neville believes it is poison since the paramedics found blue traces on the man's fingers, but there are several lines of inquiry to follow. Away from the case, Neville struggles with Sophie's betrayal and informs the Commissioner that he intends to leave Saint Marie in order to extract himself from various reminders. Ralf Little and Don Warrington star

programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Oscar-winner Helen Mirren discusses her role in Shazam! Fury of the Gods and Patrick Stewart reflects on his headlining part in Amazon's sci-fi sequel Star Trek: Picard. Multi award-winning actress, singer and dancer Ariana DeBose also appears, alongside Narcos star Pedro Pascal, who is promoting the new series of The Mandalorian. Plus, Freya Ridings performs her current single Weekends

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's Big Show
programme.desc: Michael presents another hour of entertainment, featuring Ellie Goulding singing Like a Saviour, Jermaine Jenas handing over his mobile in Send to All and a duet from the two Unexpected Stars of the Show. Plus, a contestant on The Wheel gets the surprise of her life when her edition keep getting more bizarre

programme.desc: Milwaukee Bucks v Miami Heat (Tip-off 12.30am). All the action from the Eastern Conference clash at Fiserv Forum

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Oscar-winner Helen Mirren discusses her role in Shazam! Fury of the Gods and Patrick Stewart reflects on his headlining part in Amazon's sci-fi sequel Star Trek: Picard. Multi award-winning actress, singer and dancer Ariana DeBose also appears, alongside Narcos star Pedro Pascal, who is promoting the new series of The Mandalorian. Plus, Freya Ridings performs her current single Weekends

programme.title: A View from the Terrace
programme.desc: Craig G Telfer, Craig Fowler, Shaughan McGuigan, Robert Borthwick and Joel Sked present a sideways look at Scottish football, dissecting of ins and outs of the week's action, with a variety of features covering the full spectrum from the giants to the minnows

programme.title: Live NBA
programme.desc: Milwaukee Bucks v Miami Heat (Tip-off 12.30am). All the action from the Eastern Conference clash at Fiserv Forum

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Sam Quek and Gethin Jones present the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: A former magistrate finds burglars brazenly carrying a safe out of her home and a young cashier teams up with his aunt to rugby tackle an armed robber

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A family get caught in a £20,000 food poisoning scam and investigators catch a taxi driver out after discovering his history involving 20 previous accidents. An injured inmate who wanted £8,000 after taking a tumble in his cell has his claim stopped in its tracks and two men who invented injuries to claim on a car crash are exposed and ordered to pay thousands. A builder claiming £12,000 after tripping at work slips up when he claims the fall ruined his holiday

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell examine the potential of properties in Plymouth, Wallasey in Merseyside and Tufnell Park in north London. All are sold at online auctions by developers hoping to make a profit on their investment buys

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Host Anita Manning visits the Elsecar Heritage Centre in South Yorkshire, where Tim Weeks and Caroline Hawley help two teams scour an antiques fair and pick up bargains to sell for profit at auction. Anita also pays a visit to one of Europe's largest houses

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Rob struggles to adjust to living with Scarlett, Emma challenges Luca to cook a meal and Bear is caught between two old friends in the middle of a marriage breakdown

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Sheepdog trialists Ross and James are both joined by their sons as they compete at the Macclesfield Sheepdog Trials, only to face tough competition, bad weather and difficult sheep

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A couple with two young sons and not enough room in their current home enlist Sonali Shah to help them find a bigger place in the Somerset countryside on a budget of £450,000. Away from the house hunting, Sonali checks out a local project to tackle climate change by planting half a million trees over the next five years

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Catherine and David visit the Isle of Wight. While David finds some Dutch dishes, a Chinese canister and a South Indian lamp, Catherine is pleased with a Scottish Wemyss ware jar

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Jake, Luke, Dean and Shelley compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present the magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Suki accuses Karen of stealing and Linda is torn on her decision of selling Mick's half of The Vic. Denise agrees to meet Ravi at a hotel and Sharon and Keanu agree to go on a date

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers battle each other to buy items brought in by the public including a 1960s swivel chair, a zodiac gyroscope, and a fairground game

programme.title: Scarlett's Driving School
programme.desc: Fifty-six-year-old Linda is desperate to get a driving licence so she can help look after her grandchildren, but as an 'older learner' who is hard of hearing she has failed her test six times. Teaching Linda is her 53-year-old sister Debbie, but after three years in the car together, both of them are at the end of their tethers. Can five days at Scarlett's Driving School help create some calm in the car, and more importantly give Linda the parking and navigation skills she needs to pass at her seventh attempt?

programme.title: Sort Your Life Out with Stacey Solomon
programme.desc: Stacey Solomon coaches the Smith family through a mammoth declutter as their possessions are laid out in a warehouse as though it were an art installation they discover 207 loose nappies, 145 Punjabi suits and 24 old toothbrushes amongst other things. Things get emotional as Raaj lets go of some of her late sister's belongings whom she lost to Covid two years ago. Carpenter Rob works hard to make their three bedroom hose fit six people and Dilly creates a brand-new larder while reorganising the kitchen

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Nolan Live
programme.desc: Stephen Nolan probes the issues that matter to the people of Northern Ireland, focusing on the stories of the week and the people making the headlines in lively debates, with viewers sending in their questions via text, email and tweet

programme.title: The Traitors US
programme.desc: Alliances are broken, and trust is questioned on the penultimate day in the castle. The players have the opportunity to add to the prize pot of $168,800

programme.title: The Traitors US
programme.desc: It's the final day and all that stands between the players and the prize money is the ultimate mission, the final banishing and The Fire of Truth

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones hosts the weekday magazine the magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: A homeowner makes an alarming discovery after hearing a bump in the night. A parrot owner is left spitting feathers when his beloved bird is stolen, and a doorbell camera solves the puzzle of a missing monkey-puzzle tree. Presented by Dominic Littlewood

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: Investigators apply the brakes on a series of deliberate, but very lucrative, car crashes that are putting other road users' lives in peril. A biker breaks his leg, but then tries to take the council for a ride to get a pay-out. Presented by Naga Munchetty

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Two coastal properties on the Gower Peninsula, south-west Wales, and in Suffolk as well as a small piece of land in Yardley, east Birmingham, are sold at auction. Martin Roberts, Martel Maxwell and Jacqui Joseph follow the developers' progress, all of whom have to battle rising material costs

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles and experts Caroline Hawley and Danny Sebastian go antiques-hunting in Wrexham, north Wales, before heading to Stockport for the auction. Host Eric is also faced with a mystery whose answer might be right under his nose

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Daniel and Zara throw Joe a birthday party and Ruhma and Scarlett are confused by Kirsty's living arrangements. Sid clashes with an Agency Nurse in a number of unexpected ways

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Shipbourne Farmers' Market in Kent is a vital shop window for local farmers Carla and Robin, who use the milk from the family dairy herd to produce their own cheese. Meanwhile, Kent fruit farmer Tom is hoping for a windfall of fruit sales at the market and that customers will also be interested in his new cobnut granola. Narrated by Denis Lawson

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson is tasked with finding a new home for three generations of the same family moving from London to Buckinghamshire. Away from the search, the presenter finds out what it takes to make a top-of-the-range toilet seat for some of the grandest houses in the world

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: David Harper and Catherine Southon are in south-west England, where they find items including a ceramic cat and an old clothes rail able to hang a large pair of Victorian pants. In a break from the shopping, Catherine plays dress-up as she goes to war in Weymouth, while David throws a pot in Poole

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Work colleagues Darren, Max, Adrian and Karl compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Ronan Keating host the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Nish convinces Suki to apologise to Karen to protect their image in front of the Walford residents. Eve watches from afar and heads to the Minute Mart to check on Suki

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: Entrepreneurs Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sara Davies and Steven Bartlett encounter a Berkshire couple hoping to rake in some offers on their multipurpose gardening tool. The Den then turns catwalk, witnessing a fashion show for an adaptive clothing range catering for a variety of disabilities. An app promising to reunite lost dogs with their owners pitches for additional investment, while a plant-based meal delivery service aims to get the Dragons' tastebuds tingling. Presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: The candidates embark on a mission to sell and run immersive tours in Shropshire, tasked to sell tickets, book entertainment and organise food and drink. One team deals with confused convicts, while the opposing side narrowly avoids a dining disaster. In the boardroom there's no escape, as one candidate is dismissed at the hands of Lord Sugar

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The View
programme.desc: Mark Carruthers presents a review of the week's political news, including reports on the latest events at Stormont and Westminster. Plus, comment and analysis with studio guests

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in Cardiff to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: BBC journalists including Adam Fleming and Chris Mason host a weekly round-up from Westminster, delivering the usual mix of serious analysis and light-hearted gossip about the biggest stories in politics

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: Actress and comedian Debra Stephenson, journalist and broadcaster James O'Brien, comedian and writer Shaparak Khorsandi and hair stylist Sam McKnight are in the famous black chair, answering questions on John Lennon, the books of JD Salinger, the adventures of Asterix and 1970s disco music

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Commonwealth gold medal-winning gymnast Claudia Fragapane, former Premier League striker Carlton Cole, Superbike world champion James Toseland and Olympic badminton silver medallist Gail Emms join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones hosts the weekday magazine the magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: Undercover cops pick up an international gang of pickpockets. A couple are stunned to find a stranger in their hallway, and a reckless lorry driver reverses on a motorway into oncoming traffic. Presented by Dominic Littlewood

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A woman pursuing a £10,000 payout after falling into a drain gets herself in a real hole with a dodgy tale, and a convict is caught out on CCTV making his getaway with a takeaway. Presented by Naga Munchetty

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts is in Warwickshire to see a property above a former brewery, with a quirky layout and a holey roof. Dion Dublin heads to Staffordshire to visit a three-bed mid-terrace with a huge back garden boasting elevated views over Stoke-on-Trent. The programme also revisits a property in Nottinghamshire, where a couple bought a former farm building at auction to turn into their dream 'forever home'

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Roo Irvine and Danny Sebastian help two teams look for items in Shrewsbury, while Natasha Raskin Sharp explores an incredible museum and meets the collector behind it

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Brenda finds love at the home of a clock collector, but it may just be that she has fallen for a killer. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams and Ruby-May Martinwood

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Pig farmer Peter returns to the Staffordshire County Show for the first time since he was a teenager. For show day, Lianne and Mark give their South Devon cows a beauty makeover. Narrated by Denis Lawson

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Margherita Taylor goes rural property-shopping in the Yorkshire Dales with a retired head teacher who has £400,000 to invest in her leap to the country and has signed up her daughter to help her with the decision making. Away from a high-energy house hunt, Margherita discovers how one Dales company has recently been instrumental in reviving Britain's hand-made piano heritage, an echo of production glory days during the 1920s

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: David Harper and Catherine Southon explore shops in Devon. Both are 'on the tiles' at Kingsbridge, but while Catherine opts for more traditional items, David scoops up an eel spear and a fetish doll, hoping for luck with the more outlandish. Their final auction is at Broughton Astley in Leicestershire

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Friends Romanda, Subs, Raj and Dee compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: B&B by the Sea
programme.desc: Nina Wadia was brought up near the coast in Hong Kong and has fond recollections of her time by the water, so her stay at the B&B is a chance to reminisce on her favourite memories of the seaside. However, the actress and comedian doesn't get to relax and is put to work bringing in the catch of the day - lobster. All that hard graft can't go to waste, because she's taught by chef Alex how to cook a decadent lobster linguine with wild garlic to celebrate the fresh catch. The next day offers her the opportunity to make chocolate truffles with a local chocolatier

programme.title: Amanda & Alan's Italian Job
programme.desc: Many hands make light work as Amanda Holden and Alan Carr invite local friends Fabrizio, Maria Pia and Carlos over for a plastering party, but things soon get out of hand as a spillage nearly ruins their newly laid terrazzo floor. On a shopping trek in the coastal city of Trapani, Amanda seeks modern soft furnishings for the living room, while Alan hunts for antique knick-knacks in the old town. Both reunite to style the newly designed space and reveal their labour of love, aka Casa Alamanda, to their Sicilian family

programme.title: Beyond Paradise
programme.desc: DI Humphrey Goodman and fiancée Martha Lloyd have left Saint Marie behind and having now also vacated London are temporarily living with Martha's mother. As Martha sets out to pursue her dream of running her own restaurant, Humphrey joins the Devon police force and quickly makes an impression on its somewhat eclectic team. As Humphrey throws himself into solving a perplexing case of attempted murder, he and Martha navigate life's ups and downs as faces from the past, the decisions they make and challenges of setting up a new life put their relationship to the test. Death in Paradise spin-off, starring Kris Marshall and Sally Bretton

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a renowned calypso singer's husband. Neville believes it is poison since the paramedics found blue traces on the man's fingers, but there are several lines of inquiry to follow. Away from the case, Neville struggles with Sophie's betrayal and informs the Commissioner that he intends to leave Saint Marie in order to extract himself from various reminders. Ralf Little and Don Warrington star

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: PG Tips and Lipton's are world-famous tea brands and an undercover investigation reveals that women working on plantations producing them are being pressured to have sex with their bosses in return for work. The report focuses on plantations that have been owned for years by two British companies - Unilever and James Finlay and Company - who between them have produced half the tea drunk in the UK. Reporter Tom Odula has spoken to dozens of women who say they have been sexually assaulted or harassed, while undercover footage reveals how one young woman was targeted for sex at a job interview

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: The year 1956 finds jazz-loving clergyman Sidney Chambers attending a talk by Reverend Nathaniel Todd, a member of the formative US civil rights movement. During the event, protestors disrupt the speech and release fireworks, causing the audience to panic. In the chaos, Todd's son Charles is stabbed and killed by an unseen assailant. The murder sees racial tensions spike and Geordie Keating is called in to investigate. Things are further complicated when Sidney finds himself drawn to passionate young activist, and their tentative romance faces pressure from all sides. Robson Green stars, with James Norton, Tessa Peake-Jones, Samuel West and Paterson Joseph

programme.title: Grantchester

As he struggles to remember her final words, Geordie grows concerned - both for the murdered girl, so callously abandoned outside a local slum, and for his friend's troubled state of mind. programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Will is settling into the new routines of his life in Grantchester when an unexpected phone call reveals his father has got himself into some trouble, so he asks Geordie for his help. Will hasn't been home in a while, running from a past he wants to forget, but he cannot outrun his roots for ever and when one vicious beating leads to a grisly murder at a sprawling ancestral home, scandal threatens to engulf the Davenport family - suggesting life may never be the same for Will again. Jemma Redgrave and Nathaniel Parker guest star, alongside Robson Green and Tom Brittney

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Reeling from his family tragedy, Will seeks distraction in Geordie's world where a curious case unfolds concerning the murder of a Teddy Boy at a dance hall. The dead boy's pockets reveal a library card from Esme's school, and even more disturbing - a picture of Esme herself. Geordie makes a beeline for the school and grills his frightened daughter. She pleads ignorance, but Will knows something is up when he spots her hiding a love letter. Away from her life at the vicarage, Mrs Chapman feels lost, while Cathy is left shaken by another encounter at work. Robson Green and Tom Brittney star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A former acquaintance of Nick's arrives from London and raises suspicions about a string of violent robberies. Meanwhile, Nick's mum takes a room at the Aidensfield Arms and begins helping out behind the bar. Drama, starring Nick Berry and Derek Fowlds
