programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: An actress engaged to marry a foreign prince becomes the police's number one suspect in the murder of a shady producer. Desperate to ensure she escapes prosecution, her wealthy fiance asks Poirot to catch the real killer. Unfortunately, the celebrated detective ends up concluding she has lied - or is an accomplice. David Suchet stars, with Niamh Cusack, Abigail Cruttenden and Sean Pertwee

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: After a quoits match with Aidensfield, the visiting team set off home, but disaster strikes when their coach veers off the road. Meanwhile, Nick gets a cold reception when he meets Jo's parents. Rural police drama, starring Nick Berry, Derek Fowlds, Kazia Pelka and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Live Snooker: Players Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the evening session on day three from Aldersley Village in Wolverhampton, featuring the opening quarter-final, played over the best of 11 frames. Barry Hawkins earned a hard-fought 6-5 victory over Yan Bingtao at this stage last year and went on to finish the tournament as runner-up to Neil Robertson. Jill Douglas presents, with analysis from Stephen Hendry, Alan McManus, Neal Foulds and Ken Doherty, commentary by David Hendon and Phil Yates, and reports from Rob Walker

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: The year 1956 finds jazz-loving clergyman Sidney Chambers attending a talk by Reverend Nathaniel Todd, a member of the formative US civil rights movement. During the event, protestors disrupt the speech and release fireworks, causing the audience to panic. In the chaos, Todd's son Charles is stabbed and killed by an unseen assailant. The murder sees racial tensions spike and Geordie Keating is called in to investigate. Things are further complicated when Sidney finds himself drawn to passionate young activist, and their tentative romance faces pressure from all sides. Robson Green stars, with James Norton, Tessa Peake-Jones, Samuel West and Paterson Joseph

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: With Violet gone, Sidney loses himself in drink. After a heavy whiskey session leaves him without his jacket - and little memory of the night before - he discovers to his horror that he was the last person to see a young woman alive. As he struggles to remember her final words, Geordie grows concerned - both for the murdered girl, so callously abandoned outside a local slum, and for his friend's troubled state of mind. James Norton stars, with Robson Green, Tessa Peake-Jones, Al Weaver and Kacey Ainsworth

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Geordie suspects foul play when computer laboratory head Professor Simms keels over and dies from mercury poisoning. It seems the deceased recently spent the night in the lab with someone other than his wife, possibly a fellow educated man. Geordie seeks advice from Leonard, and the pair start to uncover the surprisingly messy love lives of Simms' colleagues. Elsewhere, Cathy is brutally tricked, Will returns to Grantchester and Mrs C makes a shocking discovery. Drama, starring Robson Green and Tom Brittney

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: A relaxed Will is installed as the new vicar, though is only just back at the vicarage when Geordie drops by requesting his help. Initially reluctant to be drawn in, Will is swayed when he learns that the matter concerns Adam, a profoundly deaf boy from a devout family, whose mother has recently died following a fall. Adam's father thinks his son was responsible and the truth needs uncovering to help the family heal. Will's own troubled past threatens to colour his view of the case - and Geordie realises his new friend has demons of his own. Drama, starring Robson Green and Tom Brittney

programme.desc: Korea Republic Women v Italy Women (Kick-off 4.45pm). Coverage of both teams' final match of the round-robin tournament, held at Ashton Gate in Bristol. programme.title: Arnold Clark Cup Live
programme.desc: England Women v Belgium Women (Kick-off 7.45pm). All the action from the final match of the round-robin tournament, held at Ashton Gate in Bristol. The sides last met in a warm-up match ahead of England's victorious Euro 2022 campaign, with the Lionesses prevailing 3-0 in Wolverhampton thanks to strikes by Chloe Kelly and Rachel Daly and a late own goal by Nicky Evrard. Laura Woods presents, with analysis from Ian Wright, Eni Aluko and Karen Carney, commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Emma Hayes, and reports from Katie Shanahan

programme.title: Minder

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: The fossil record shows that the arapaima fish has roamed the waters of the Amazon River since the Jurassic age, and uses its bony tongue to crush prey against the roof of its mouth before swallowing. Biologist and extreme angler Jeremy Wade encountered the species once before and came out second best, so this time he is taking no chances as he investigates every aspect of this huge creature

programme.title: Live Snooker: Players Championship

programme.desc: Simon Templar becomes the target of a paid assassin and has to whittle down a list of potential avengers to find out who wants him killed. Time appears to not be on his side after a female journalist friend is abducted. Roger Moore stars, with Suzanne Lloyd

programme.title: Robin of Sherwood
programme.desc: The outlaws are attacked by a group of angry Crusaders who believe Robin is a thief. Michael Praed stars

programme.title: Magnum, PI
programme.desc: A pilot crashes on the estate while flying a plane from Texas to Hawaii - but Thomas finds the circumstances of the mishap suspicious and soon discovers it was no accident. Tom Selleck stars

programme.title: The Sweeney
programme.desc: The Flying Squad is assigned to ensure the safe shipment of a gold bullion consignment, threatened by the plans of a brilliant computer expert bent on revenge. Drama, guest starring George Cole and John Hurt, with John Thaw and Dennis Waterman

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Arthur buys a large consignment of wine, supposedly brewed by monks. Before he can collect his order it is impounded, but he sneaks into a warehouse and retrieves it anyway. However, a disastrous tasting session at the Winchester reveals the product to be 'corked' and undrinkable and when he and Ray return it in the hope of a later refund they get locked in. George Cole and Gary Webster star

programme.title: The Saint
programme.desc: Simon Templar agrees to help a girl find her missing brother and becomes embroiled in a drug-smuggling operation. Roger Moore and Burt Kwouk star

programme.title: Live Snooker: Players Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the afternoon session on day five from Aldersley Village in Wolverhampton, featuring the concluding quarter-final, played over the best of 11 frames. Jill Douglas presents, with analysis from Stephen Hendry, Alan McManus, Neal Foulds and Ken Doherty, commentary by David Hendon and Phil Yates, and reports from Rob Walker

programme.title: Made in Britain
programme.desc: A look behind the scenes at British brands, including an insight into how Yorkshire puddings are made on a huge scale, and life inside Britain's last remaining pencil factory. Plus, how one man's quest to make the perfect present for his dad ended with him producing handmade globes that are now in demand around the world. Narrated by Ricky Tomlinson

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Arthur's other half, 'er Indoors, disappears and he finds himself under suspicion of burying her on the forecourt in order to use the insurance money to prop up his dubious business ventures. Vintage comedy drama, starring George Cole and Gary Webster

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Extreme angler Jeremy Wade travels to the foothills of the Himalayas to investigate stories of deadly attacks by the man-eating goonch catfish, tracking down the species to establish if its methods of killing are as gruesome as reports suggest

programme.title: World of Sport
programme.desc: Richard Henwood takes a look back at The Indoor League. A show featuring 1970s pub games, presented by Yorkshire cricketing great Fred Trueman.

programme.title: Live Snooker: Players Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the evening session on day five from Aldersley Village in Wolverhampton, featuring the opening semi-final, played over the best of 11 frames. Barry Hawkins produced a strong display at this stage of the 2022 tournament to prevail 6-2 against Ricky Walden, but his wait for a first ranking tournament title since 2017 continued when he was defeated by Neil Robertson in the final. Jill Douglas presents, with analysis from Stephen Hendry, Alan McManus, Neal Foulds and Ken Doherty, commentary by David Hendon and Phil Yates, and reports from Rob Walker

programme.title: All Elite Wrestling: Dynamite
programme.desc: Hard-hitting action from the world of All Elite Wrestling - the roster features world-class talent including Jon Moxley, Chris Jericho, Bryan Danielson and Claudio Castagnoli, and many more who bring a freshness and energy into professional wrestling

programme.title: Robin of Sherwood

programme.title: Smarty Pants
programme.desc: Animated comedy series about three kids and their missions from the Great Book of Cooldom. There's a sports championship at the local stadium - the competition is the kids' chance to win a medal. If they do, they could be as popular as top athlete Flavio Tamaley, but it's been ages since they've done any sports - however, the championship is a competition for babies... but as there are no age limits in the rules, our intrepid trio decide to join in and to try to win every event on offer.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Fizz tries to become an influencer in the makeup industry. To get more likes, he organises a meet-up for his subscribers, but Magoo steals the limelight.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. When a crab spider parachutes into his life, Lloyd calls her Crabbie Spindles and decides to raise her as a vegetarian and single-handedly change fly-spider relationships forever! However, it becomes clear that Lloyd's bitten off more than he can chew...

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. There is an exciting new Ghost Coaster inside the sofa, but Lloyd, PB and Abacus are too short to go on it - however, Lloyd refuses to allow his height to get in the way of fun, and so he devises a way to make the three of them appear tall enough to ride it.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. Lil' Sue turns into a stomping green-eyed monster, and it is up to Dave and the rest of Lil' Sue's friends to calm her down before she ends up big and green forever.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. According to Gareth the starfish, every pancake has two sides, happy and grumpy. If Dave is to leave his pancake on the grumpy side, he had better prepare himself for an adventure... on the flipside!

programme.title: Scooby-Doo! Mystery Incorporated
programme.desc: Scooby and the gang arrange a mass sleepover to deal with a poltergeist that is attacking Mayor Jones

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: When a successful video game company tries to convince Velma to work for them in San Francisco, the gang becomes embroiled in the mystery of a video game villain

programme.title: Buck and Buddy
programme.desc: Beetle Buck and stick insect Buddy are the best of friends who like to collect unusual and interesting things from the strange world in which they live.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Fizz wants to create a fascinating mystery about himself - while he traces his giant geoglyphs portrait in the desert sand, Mr Magoo appears with his golfing gear.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. His genius still unappreciated, Fizz decides to go on a spiritual retreat in a forest clearing, but Mr Magoo, who believes that he's on an orangutan reserve, mistakes the hamster for a feral child.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Fizz invents the MutoFizz, a device which can render anyone mute... even the President! However, when Mr Magoo gets his hands on the invention, Fizz and Weasel end up mute, and he mistakes them for Parisian mimes.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. While Weasel takes his annual holiday, Fizz tries out the MeteoFizz, which allows him to control the weather - when Mr Magoo finds the remote control of the machine, he is convinced that an interactive treasure hunt has started.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Fizz wants to win a contest to find the world's most incredible animal, but Mr Magoo appears with Mr Cat while thinking that he's at the groomer's - finding the groomer (Weasel) too overwhelmed, Mr Magoo decides to help out...

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Fizz steals the President's panda - whoever has an animal that cute will surely attain power and glory, but when the animal escapes Weasel's protection and ends up at Mr Magoo's house, he is mistaken by Mr Magoo for his nephew.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Fizz's latest invention is derailed and Weasel suddenly becomes very intelligent - he decides to improve Fizz's plans, but the two aren't on the same wavelength... and there's only room for one genius on this planet!

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Weasel sneezes and Fizz, who is a complete hypochondriac, is convinced that his assistant is sick. Terrified of catching his cold, Fizz desperately tries to escape Weasel, but Mr Magoo shows up intent on pampering his sick neighbour.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. The birthdays of Fizz and Mr Magoo fall on the same day - Mr Cat organises a party for his owner, but Weasel has nothing planned as Fizz has no friends... that is, unless Weasel steals Mr Magoo's guests.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Fizz wants to trap Mr Magoo - while Weasel captures Mr Cat and sends him to a far-off destination, Fizz demands a ransom from Mr Magoo and sends him an anonymous letter with a meeting point. However, Mr Magoo mistakes the letter for a treasure map...

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Mr Magoo, who is on the roof of a building, believes he's by the sea - when he dives in to save a drowning swimmer (in reality, a statue in a traffic circle) he is struck by Fizz's laser and then becomes weightless.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Mr Magoo replaces his friend Serge for the day as a personal trainer - while he thinks he's giving a swimming lesson at the pool, he appears at Weasel's house at the worst moment: for the first time in his life, Fizz is out of ideas...

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. While Mr Magoo prepares for a spin on his new boat (actually a shopping cart), he notices the Aerofizz in the distance - convinced that he's under attack from a ghost ship, Mr Magoo aims to defend the city at all costs.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. During a heatwave, Fizz installs a giant fan at the top of a building under construction to cool down the city while diffusing his scent - however, Mr Magoo, who thinks that he's taking Marnie out for an ice cream, finds himself at the top of the tower instead...

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. In order to abolish work, Fizz has replaced the city's workers with clones, but Mr Magoo mistakes the clones for extraterrestrials, and seeing them working hard, he decides to teach them to relax.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. In order to become a superhero, Fizz invents a scanner that allows him to take on the physical abilities of animals - while he tests his invention in the park, Mr Magoo appears and mistakes Weasel for his personal trainer.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. When a flea epidemic breaks out in the city, Fizz takes advantage of it to invent a flute that repels the parasites - as Weasel is sent to the park to play the instrument, Mr Magoo appears and mistakes his neighbour for a sea lion.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Mr Magoo finds his childhood puppet and wants to have it repaired, but he turns up at Weasel's house when mistakenly thinking that it's the toy repair shop. In shock, Weasel stuffs Fizz inside the puppet... and Mr Magoo believes that his toy has come to life.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. It's Valentine's Day! While Fizz is in rapture over his Fizzroses, Magoo plans the perfect date for Weasel and Linda as he takes them on a sewer tour.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. To make the world's biggest fries, Fizz invents the Fizzometer. But Weasel messes up and shrinks Fizz! Magoo is fascinated by all things tiny.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Magoo likes the idea of having fresh eggs every morning, but his newly adopted hen Jeanine has disappeared! He goes to Weasel's house and mistakes Fizz for the bird!

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Aspiring to be a great movie director, Fizz tries to shoot a heroic fantasy film with Weasel dressed in a ridiculous horse costume.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. To compensate for his lack of physical strength, Fizz creates Fizz-Junior, a super-powerful hamster. Magoo mistakes Junior for a kid.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Fizz tries to become an influencer in the makeup industry. To get more likes, he organises a meet-up for his subscribers, but Magoo steals the limelight.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Fizz uses the TransmorgaFizz to give Weasel a more muscular body. But, the invention ends up in Magoo's hands and our hero turns Fizz into a chihuahua.

programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Fizz wants to test out the PrestodigiousFizz - a magic wand - during a magic show, but when he runs into Magoo, he mistakes him for someone else.

programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. While Magoo is on a witch hunt, Weasel receives a surprise visit from his bitter, waspy, old-fashioned mother. Fizz and Mrs. Weasel's first encounter is explosive.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd and Abacus are on the hunt for a nice quiet spot to play their favourite board game - the trouble is that everywhere is either too loud, too busy, or too dangerous! They finally find the perfect place... but then they forget to take gravity into account.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd has an unexpected windfall of crumbs and sets out to buy happiness, cleaning the newsstand out of comics, dining at the Pancake, and hiring his friends to carry his lovely crumbs around - however, he soon learns that crumbs can't buy true happiness.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. With Gena and Malcolm out for the evening, Lloyd is left in charge of PB and 224 maggots - how hard can maggotsitting be? Keen to get his duties over as quickly as possible, Lloyd skimps on the bedtime story, prompting a mass exodus of maggots!

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd adopts a tardigrade as a pet in spite of his parents warning that they never live for long. Regardless of his efforts to keep Nutbum alive, Lloyd finds it apparently dead the next day - thankfully, Cornea knows exactly what to do!

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Keen to prove that he is hard-working to Queen Libby and his parents, Lloyd volunteers to work in the ant colony for a day, swapping with ant Annie 209 to replace him at home. However, things don't go to plan, and Lloyd creates chaos in the colony...

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd tries to educate PB about the danger of spiders by luring one out with a decoy fly - his clumsy attempts attract a curious spider called Julie, who PB immediately wants to befriend. Can Lloyd accept that some spiders may not be all that bad?

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd hears that Berry is moving into his own place, and to avoid looking immature by comparison, Lloyd finds himself caught up in a spiralling series of lies as he tries to convince everyone that he's moving into a luxurious giant mango in the big bin.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd wants to show everyone that he can manage without Abacus, but he soon gets into a series of disasters on his own. He ends up lost in a rug, covered in sticky orange juice, and being chased by hungry carpet beetles that may or may not to want to eat him...

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Cornea invites Lloyd and his family to dinner, but they can't stomach Cornea's unique cooking and adopt a series of bizarre ways to try and avoid eating the food without offending their host.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd tries to compete with Berry and prove that he's 'more caring' by rescuing flies whether they want or need rescuing or not - however, his zealousness backfires when he attempts a daring rescue 'outside'!

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Sucked into the vacuum cleaner, Catastrophe Jim tries to convince Lloyd, Abacus and PB that they are now in the afterlife. Lloyd refuses to believe that a life as significant as his could be over so soon, so he sets out to prove that they're still alive.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd is cross when Berry brings his parents fruit fresh from the fridge - if anyone's going to raid the fridge, it should be him! Lloyd and Abacus therefore head to the fridge with Berry as their guide, but they find themselves unprepared for the cold...

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd tries to convince everyone that he's not afraid when they visit a spooky new attraction in the Backov Zofar. Nothing scares him - not even the 'ghost insects' who swoop out of the darkness - but when Abacus goes missing, Lloyd has to face his fears.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd and Abacus' friendship is tested when they find a chrysalis and can't agree on what to do with it - they think they have the answer when the chrysalis starts communicating with a series of knocks, but is it one knock for 'yes' or one knock for 'no'?

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. When Bob's best friend Gummy goes missing, Lloyd and Abacus take on the task of finding him... which is only right as they were the ones who lost him. Lloyd suspects foul play, so he compiles a list of suspects and starts following the clues.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd always has Abacus over for dinner, so PB persuades Malcolm and Gena to let her invite Julie the Spider for dinner too. However, Lloyd's not convinced by Julie's promise not to eat them... and he decides to take precautions to ensure that his family don't become dinner!

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd's plans with Abacus are ruined when he has to go on a family trip to Caterpillar World, but PB can't wait - she's finally going to find out the gory details of what happens inside a chrysalis! However, the show is not what either of them was expecting...

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. PB has heard that there's a blob of peanut butter on the kitchen counter, but Lloyd's supposed to be maggotsitting and can't leave - faced with the prospect of missing out on the peanut butter, Lloyd therefore concocts a plan to take his maggotsitting duties with him!

She never returned, having apparently vanished into thin air. Presenter Emilia Fox, leading criminologist Professor David Wilson and former senior detective Dr Graham Hill investigate the circumstances surrounding Trevaline's disappearance and identify several new suspects

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick steps out of his comfort zone by heading to South Africa to spend time with the magnificent animals of the savannah and the selfless people who dedicate their lives to looking after them - often in very difficult circumstances. Noel meets the animals threatened by poaching, injured due to neglect in captivity, and exploited in one way or another. The pioneering vet also helps endangered rhinos and improve the lives of two big cats by performing procedures rarely - if ever - provided for wild animals before

programme.title: In the Footsteps of Killers
programme.desc: Emilia Fox and criminologist David Wilson investigate the disappearance of 13-year-old David Spencer and 11-year-old Patrick Warren, who went missing in Birmingham on Boxing Day in 1996. To this day, no one has been charged with the double disappearance and murder of the two friends, and their bodies have never been found despite two major police investigations and a missing persons campaign that featured the boys' pictures on milk cartons. But now, Emilia and David discover new evidence leading to a prime suspect

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics and doctors rush to a man who has fallen headfirst down a flight of stairs outside a hospital. A woman calls an ambulance for both herself and her husband. Passers-by report a man having a seizure in the street, who then has a second fit in the back of the ambulance, while an anxious mother calls for help when her nine-week-old baby cannot go to the toilet

programme.title: SAS: Who Dares Wins
programme.desc: The remaining recruits' will to survive is severely tested with an extraction task used in the Vietnam War, and there's an intense beasting in a fight for the survival of the fittest. With the hardships of the jungle closing in, a lack of sleep, a calorie deficit from ration packs, and their bodies starting to fail, will any of the recruits make it through a survival task that requires navigating through the jungle pursued by hunters during a mission behind enemy lines?

programme.title: SAS: Who Dares Wins
programme.desc: The remaining recruits are ambushed and handed over to interrogators for questioning. They must endure psychological and physical punishments designed to break their will while sticking to their cover story. The end is near but will the final seven prove magnificent or not?

programme.title: Ukraine from Above: Secrets from the Frontline
programme.desc: A year after Russia's invasion, this documentary charts the heroic efforts of Ukraine's people to defeat Russia's army in a war that's often been fought and observed from the air. Military strategists use satellite data to plan their next move and investigators gather images from space to reveal suspected Russian war crimes, while drone photography of key locations from before and after the war demonstrate the scale of destruction

The pair make an unlikely connection as they bond over finding ways to cope with the challenges in their lives. Fact-based drama, starring Kate Mara and David Oyelowo

Meanwhile, in the New Forest, Georgie and Will are desperate to live together after seven years of being a couple. However, with Will working in Belgium during the week, the pair are finding suitable properties are snapped up before they have even had the chance to view them

Romantic comedy Western, starring Maureen O'Hara and James Stewart

programme.title: The Tin Star (1957)
programme.desc: A world-weary bounty hunter, formerly a sheriff, arrives in a small town where a newly-appointed lawman is struggling to keep the peace. When he learns of the mercenary's past, the inexperienced lawman seeks his help in learning the tricks of the trade so he can bring an outlaw gang to justice. Anthony Mann's Western, starring Henry Fonda, Anthony Perkins, Lee Van Cleef, Betsy Palmer and Michel Ray

programme.title: Tobruk (1967)
programme.desc: Jewish resistance fighters out to destroy Nazi fuel bunkers during the North African campaign recruit a Canadian major experienced in desert warfare. Risking life and limb, they pose as a German transport detail escorting British prisoners, but it becomes clear that someone in their group is a traitor. Second World War adventure, starring George Peppard, Rock Hudson, Nigel Green and Guy Stockwell

programme.title: Kindergarten Cop (1990)
programme.desc: A tough detective is forced to pose as a preschool teacher in a bid to capture a drug dealer whose son is one of the pupils. However, his biggest challenge turns out to be controlling a class full of five-year-olds. Comedy, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Penelope Ann Miller, Linda Hunt, Pamela Reed and Richard Tyson

programme.title: AI: Artificial Intelligence (2001)
programme.desc: A highly advanced robotic boy is created with one purpose - to love his owner as a parent. When he is rejected by his 'mother', he is left to roam the bleak landscapes of a futuristic America with a fellow android, searching for a means of becoming a real boy in the hope of regaining her love. Steven Spielberg's sci-fi drama, starring Haley Joel Osment, Jude Law, William Hurt and Frances O'Connor

programme.title: Honey Boy (2019)
programme.desc: A twentysomething movie star struggling with alcohol addiction is ordered to attend a rehab facility, where a doctor encourages him to look into his past to cope with and understand his present-day demons. He recalls a childhood shaped by his unpredictable father, a one-time rodeo clown. Drama written by and starring Shia LaBeouf, with Laura San Giacomo

programme.title: Dancehall Queen (1997)
programme.desc: A single mother has to contend with a criminal threatening her street stall and a man she does money to demanding sex with her daughter. She dons a disguise to compete in a dancing contest, but when neither of the men causing her trouble recognise her, she seizes the chance to turn them against one another. Jamaican drama, starring Audrey Reid and Paul Campbell

programme.title: The Black Shield of Falworth (1954)
programme.desc: The son of a disgraced medieval nobleman is raised in poverty. With the support of a kindly earl, he gains the chance to train as a knight and reclaim his birthright, proving his worth by fighting to foil a plot to overthrow the king. Swashbuckling adventure, starring Tony Curtis, Janet Leigh, David Farrar and Barbara Rush

programme.title: The Gentle Sex (1943)
programme.desc: Seven women from vastly different backgrounds are brought together as volunteers in the Auxiliary Territorial Service during the Second World War. Despite their differences they become firm friends during training and on assignment driving military transport and operating anti-aircraft guns. Drama, starring Rosamund John, Joan Greenwood, Lilli Palmer, John Justin and Joan Gates

programme.title: Night Passage (1957)
programme.desc: The black sheep of a family falls in with a gang of outlaws plotting to rob a train operated by his strait-laced brother, but reckons without his sibling's determination to track him down and set him back on the straight and narrow. Western, starring James Stewart, Audie Murphy, Dan Duryea and Brandon de Wilde

programme.title: Yangtse Incident (1957)
programme.desc: A British frigate is heavily shelled and captured by Chinese communists on the Yangtse River in 1949. After a failed rescue mission by a sister ship, the remaining crew members put into action a daring escape plan that involves disguising the vessel and slipping her moorings under the cover of darkness. Fact-based action adventure, starring Richard Todd, William Hartnell and Akim Tamiroff

programme.title: Fantastic Four (2015)
programme.desc: A gifted young scientist joins members of a secret project researching inter-dimensional travel, and they return from a journey to another world with superhuman powers. Their abilities make them the only hope for Earth's survival when a colleague who was lost on their expedition returns to wreak vengeance. Superhero adventure, starring Miles Teller, Michael B Jordan, Kate Mara and Jamie Bell

programme.title: Pixie (2020)
programme.desc: To avenge her mother's death, a young woman named Pixie masterminds a heist but must flee across Ireland from gangsters, take on the patriarchy, and choose her own destiny along the way. Crime comedy, starring Olivia Cooke, Fra Fee and Rory Fleck Byrne

programme.title: Bull (2021)
programme.desc: After a decade away, gangland enforcer Bull returns to the streets where he used to do the bidding of his father-in-law, sadistic mob boss Norm. The men fell out when Norm's daughter Gemma developed a drug addiction and Bull demanded sole custody of their son, Aiden. Bull's return ignites the fuse on an orgy of violence targeted at the crime lord and his minions. Thriller, starring Neil Maskell, David Hayman and Tamzin Outhwaite

programme.title: Kill List (2011)
programme.desc: A hitman with money worries is persuaded by his old partner to take on one last job. The duo's mysterious client presents them with a list of three targets, but as they go about their deadly work, they start to realise there is something far more disturbing going on than a simple act of murder. Thriller, with Neil Maskell, Michael Smiley and MyAnna Buring

programme.title: The Devil's Doorway (2018)
programme.desc: In the autumn of 1960, Father Thomas Riley and Father John Thornton are sent by the Vatican to investigate a miraculous event in an Irish home for 'fallen women', only to uncover something much more terrifying. Horror, starring Lalor Roddy, Ciaran Flynn and Helena Bereen

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Warren's day goes from bad to worse when his child goes missing and a health scare leads him to some devastating assumptions

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Norma warns Sienna that there is nothing she wouldn't do to protect her family. Meanwhile, a heated discussion between Dave and Honour makes her feelings clear

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay heads to Charlie's Italian bistro in La Verne, southern California, where the owner's lack of business nous is putting her relatives' homes at risk, after her mother and sister put them up as collateral. To make matters worse, the restaurant's food is less than appetising and its long-serving chef seems to be incompetent

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Baltimore, Maryland, where Denise Whiting has alienated customers by trademarking the word 'hon', a term of endearment used by the local community. When she opened Cafe Hon in 1992 it was a roaring success, but as a result of Denise's unwavering business ambition, people started to boycott the restaurant, leaving her frustrated by falling sales

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Afraid that she'll be left alone in her old age, Beverly seeks her children's advice on assembling a circle of friends for her later years and attempts to bond with other mothers to form their own group like The Golden Girls. Geoff's romantic gestures begin to annoy Erica, but when she tries to reciprocate, she almost brings their relationship to an end

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Erica is appalled when Geoff arranges for them to go out to dinner with her family to celebrate her birthday. Geoff soon discovers that dinner with the Goldbergs is no ordinary meal out: the family repeatedly change tables, Murray insists Adam order from the children's menu, the food is sent back to the kitchen, and Barry wants to amend his order but Beverly won't allow it. By the end of the evening, Geoff reaches breaking-point

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Penny ask Howard and Bernadette for advice when they argue about money. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.desc: A prank goes disastrously wrong, destroying a crucial piece of evidence, leaving the officers trying to solve the mystery - with the help of visiting detective Frank Dillman. Guest starring JK Simmons

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj is asked to create a message on the off-chance a Nasa mission discovers alien life, and the guys fight over what he should do. Meanwhile, Penny contemplates returning to acting. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons, Kaley Cuoco and Kunal Nayyar

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil is placed in the awkward position of having to fire Mitchell, while Cameron and Claire clash over their opposing theories on how to discipline children. programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Mitchell and Cameron continue their quest to adopt another child, enlisting the help of Gloria as a translator. Jay and Manny are left alone to look after Lily as she prepares for a dance recital, while Claire and Phil send Alex off to her first prom. Haley causes a stir when she announces her future plans

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The comedy reaches its end with the second part of the finale and a concluding look back at the characters' journeys over the years

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Detective Jake Peralta and his eclectic group of colleagues at Brooklyn's 99th Precinct are used to having a commanding officer who doesn't make them work too hard or follow the rules too closely. That all changes when tightly wound Captain Ray Holt takes over, determined to make the dysfunctional squad into the best in the borough. Pilot episode of the American comedy, starring Andy Samberg and Andre Braugher

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard is offered an exciting job opportunity, but it will mean he has to leave the country for several months. Penny tries to support his ambitions, while Sheldon is jealous and attempts to discourage him from accepting the post. Meanwhile, Raja pushes the boundaries with Lucy, but puts their relationship in jeopardy

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Penny bond as they miss Leonard, and Howard tries to help Raj get over his break-up with Lucy. Meanwhile, Bernadette and Amy visit an out-of-town biology convention. Comedy about four high-achieving scientists, starring Jim Parsons, Kaley Cuoco and Johnny Galecki

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Amy's academic rivals embark on a publicity tour, so the couple try to get the Nobel laureates on their side. Halley's fear of the dark leads to opportunity and conflict for Howard, Bernadette and Stuart

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy has a meltdown when she feels the pressure of what it would mean for women everywhere if she were to win a Nobel Prize. Raj and Howard attempt to relive the good old days when Howard buys a scooter that looks like the one he had years earller

The B&Bers share a lively game of bowls and at dinner, youngsters Sam and Henry's age and experience are subjected to scrutiny. Elaine faces a tough time in the kitchen and the feedback turns up the heat

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves to the Bear and Swan in Chew Magna in Somerset, where Sam Wilkins and Henry Russell hope to impress with the five-star rooms above their country pub

programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to the Guesthouse East in Eastbourne, where Tony and Lisa Partridge hope to impress their guests with their family friendly B&B

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Jorge Mesquita plays host at the Shirley B&B, Bournemouth, where he believes the guests will be impressed by his power showers and hopes a go-karting contest will help him win

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Jorge Mesquita of the Shirley B&B is taken ill, so the remaining B&Bers fight it out for the prized plaque as they meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and settle some scores

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer are house-hunting in south London with two couples at different stages of their lives. Jess and Zak are searching in a popular area, and post-lockdown have realised they want a good-sized garden and more space indoors to work from home. Kirstie is with Rachel and Alan, who call themselves the oldest first-time buyers in town. Fed up with paying a whopping £2,000 a month in rent they want their own home - a place they can put their own stamp on

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It

programme.title: Grand Designs

Dall wants the end project to be perfect - from the finish of his mirrored cruciform steel columns, to how the floor tiles line up with the dining room table, and is willing to spend whatever it takes to achieve his vision. However, the construction represents a huge risk, as down one road lies abject failure and financial ruin, while down the other, is the creation of something sublime and almost heroic

programme.title: Amanda Owen's Farming Lives

programme.title: The World's Wildest Weather

programme.desc: Former boxer Paul, 22, has been stabbed in the face and arm with a broken bottle outside a nightclub in Kingston. Angela, 93, is brought to A&E by her daughter Elizabeth after suffering from blood loss and disorientation at her care home, while 70-year-old John arrives with his wife Francesca after falling while out running and dislocating his shoulder. programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.desc: Chef Tony Singh and presenter Sophie Morgan compete to make the best holiday snow globes, and TV personality Mark-Francis Vandelli goes head to head with queen of clean Aggie MacKenzie to make intricate jelly art

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Kent retirees David and Donna Bradley want to relocate permanently to Menorca, so Laura Hamilton shows them five properties for their £300,000 budget

programme.desc: A Birmingham couple start a cooking school with a difference in France. A glampsite owner in Italy finds a potential pot of gold on her land and a Staffordshire couple have a devastating start to their new life in Spain

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon O'Brien turns car seats into a three-piece suite during a trip to Leyland, while Henry Cole repurposes an overhead light into a fashionable light box

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It

programme.title: Heir Hunters

Plus, details of two unclaimed estates where heirs still need to be found

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at the Edge Accommodation in Huddersfield, West Yorkshire, where owner John Whitworth is hoping to win over his guests with his unique style and personality

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

Nigel quickly fell for their rural location's incredible views, but Catherine has never loved the place and misses having neighbours, so Phil searches for a home that pleases them both, offering room for Nigel's beloved chickens, while giving Catherine more people around her

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau

programme.title: Grand Designs

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

The team members carry out extensive tests on 93-year-old John, who is suffering from shortness of breath, and in the children's emergency unit, seven-year-old Hunter is being assessed after falling from a tree

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency?

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It

programme.title: Heir Hunters

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The team treats two trauma patients arriving by helicopter on the hospital's new helipad. Eric, 75, collapsed shortly after falling from a ladder while pruning trees in his garden. He is stabilised and put in an induced coma while a CT scan is used to determine any internal injuries. IT consultant Mihhail, 29, is admitted after crashing his motorbike at high speed and again a CT scan is employed to look for hidden wounds. He's later transferred to the Intensive Care Unit while specialists decide how to repair the damage to his liver and stop his internal bleeding. Meanwhile, 22-year-old performing arts student Maria complains of chest pains and 82-year-old Rusty is treated for a broken ankle sustained in a road accident

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Freddie, seven, is brought in after falling several metres from a tree in his garden. Martin, 66, collapsed at home and spent the night on the floor, and he's now experiencing poor eyesight and dizziness. The stroke team diagnoses a blood clot, but because of the amount of time that has passed since the incident, clot-busting drugs will have little effect. Elsewhere, eight-year-old Jayden has come to St George's with swollen eyes, the result of severe hay fever

programme.desc: Dave has a BMW X5 armed response vehicle build to oversee, and is also tasked with repairing a car damaged during a high-speed chase

programme.desc: The three motoring enthusiasts head to Spain on a mission to help its struggling economy - but the convertible supercars they take are very expensive and anything but discreet. With Jeremy Clarkson in a McLaren MP4-12C, Richard Hammond driving a Ferrari 458 and James May behind the wheel of an Audi R8 V10, the trio encounter mountain passes, empty towns and an abandoned airport before creating their own street circuit in a deserted Madrid development. Plus, Sherlock star Benedict Cumberbatch sets a lap time in the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on a project to build a car that can turn into a hovercraft and bring relief to flooded areas. Their efforts do not start smoothly, but it is not long before the trio are demonstrating the brilliance of their creation with an eventful journey down the River Avon. Plus, Jeremy grabs the keys to two variants of the Mercedes-Benz SLS AMG supercar - the V8-engined Black Series with a roaring 622bhp, and the 740bhp Electric Drive, which is powered by four electric motors. X-Men and Les Miserables star Hugh Jackman is the latest celebrity to take the new Reasonably Priced Car around the test track

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May take a look at increasingly popular tall hatchbacks known as crossovers. Having concluded their primary appeal is to caravanners, the duo spend a couple of days in models by Mazda and Volkswagen and try to get a feel for what life is like for the people they believe would buy one. Meanwhile, Richard Hammond drives a pair of exciting Lamborghinis in Italy - the ferocious Aventador Roadster and the limited-edition Sesto Elemento, which carries an eye-watering price tag of around £2million. Two cars are also put through their paces on the test track, with James in a modern re-creation of the classic Porsche 911 and Aerosmith frontman Steven Tyler in the rather less exotic Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson drives the Jaguar F-Type sports car on some of Britain's finest roads, while Richard Hammond jumps inside the Range Rover Sport and gives it a thorough workout off-road, on a track and in what he believes is its most natural habitat - the lanes of Cheshire. James May goes for a countryside adventure in the New Routemaster London bus brought into use in 2013, which is propelled by a turbodiesel generator and a powerful electric motor. Inspired by the machines they have tested, the trio then meet to celebrate Britain's motor industry with a grand finale in front of Buckingham Palace. programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the mid-engined Alfa Romeo 4C on the shores of Lake Como in Italy - but his enjoyment of the lightweight vehicle is disturbed by the arrival of Jeremy Clarkson, who demands a race against his quad bike. Jeremy also visits Belgium, putting the McLaren P1 hypercar to the test in Bruges and around the Spa-Francorchamps Formula One circuit - and its combined power output of more than 900bhp generated from electricity and turbocharged petrol V8 power is likely to cause astonishment. Meanwhile, James May spends time at Camp Bastion in Afghanistan to learn about the army's vehicle redeployment efforts, and Thor star Tom Hiddleston tries to coax the best time he can muster from the Reasonably Priced Car

Not only that, but there are encounters with an aggressive bull in a field and a terrifying truck driver to endure. programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The story of Hitler's former deputy Hermann Goering, who emerged from house arrest in May 1945 and made his way to American lines in the hope of surrendering to them rather than the Russians. After being imprisoned at Nuremberg, he committed suicide by poisoning in October 1946

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: While Nazi scientists were conducting brutal experiments in an attempt to create an Aryan master race, a team of zoologists were overseeing their own bizarre science trials

programme.desc: Robbie Cumming explores the English canal network. A low canal tunnel in Staffordshire proves to be problematic and Robbie helps out a stranded boater

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson examines the history of Walberswick, the former medieval port on the Suffolk coast, which is now a favourite retreat for writers, artists and day trippers. For centuries the village lurched from prosperity to poverty and in medieval times a bitter battle for supremacy was fought against the neighbouring port of Dunwich

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo visits the sites of Victorian freak shows, rides one of the world's first electric railways in Southend and encounters the preserved head of a medieval politician as he continues his journey along the route of the Great Eastern Line

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Epping, Essex, to Hackney in north-east London, discovering why dairy herds were transported by train all over Britain. He also finds out the importance of the gunpowder trade to Waltham Cross, and learns the gruesome details of the first murder to take place on a train

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the final leg of his journey, Michael Portillo rediscovers a once-famous poet in Nottingham and travels on a railway line resurrected by popular demand after falling victim to Beeching's cuts. He finds out how Doncaster rail workers shaped British political history, before reaching his final destination of Leeds, where he auditions at Britain's oldest continuously working music hall

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the first leg of a journey from Southampton to Wolverhampton, beginning by being taught how to set a table aboard the luxury liner Queen Elizabeth. In the village of Netley he finds the remains of an extensive military hospital built by order of Queen Victoria, and ends his travels in Basingstoke, where he learns out about a pitched battle between townspeople and the Salvation Army

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek gets a tour of Hadlow Castle in Kent when he arrives to collect the owner's pre-war Alvis and an immaculate Citroen used by the Gestapo in occupied France

programme.title: Bangers and Cash

programme.desc: Robbie Cumming's exploration of the English canal network continues across the Pennines from Marple to Huddersfield, where his journey is hampered by a fallen tree and a leaking lock pound

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson examines the history of Robin Hood's Bay, the fishing village on the North Yorkshire coast, revealing tales of smuggling intrigue and bravery

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his 1913 railway guide, Michael Portillo travels through Italy from Turin to Venice.Along the way, he recreates a scene from the Michael Caine film The Italian Job on a Fiat test track and takes a trip in a seaplane to investigate the early 20th-century British love affair with Lake Como. In Verona, he visits the house used to attract Edwardian tourists to the alleged setting of Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet and finds a microcosm of pre-First World War Europe at the Venice Biennale art exhibition

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's India
programme.desc: Joanna's adventures across India conclude as she explores Rajasthan, Delhi and the mountainous North West, before ending in Kashmir, the place of her birth. Her first stop takes her to the Ranthambhore National Park, where she learns about the Wildlife Protection Society of India's tiger conservation programmes. Joanna's next stop takes her to the city of Delhi, where she begins her exploration of the capital at Humayun's Tomb, before ending her 5000 mile journey in Srinagar in Kashmi, the place where she was born

programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues to follow the route of the Great Eastern Line, enjoying a ride on a miniature railway hidden beneath London. During his trip, he also rings the bells of Bow Church, and tries his hand at announcing at Fenchurch Street station

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo retraces railway journeys made by Queen Victoria in the south of England, where she would travel from Windsor Castle in Berkshire to her summer retreat on the Isle of Wight. The first leg of the trip takes him from Windsor's railway station to Didcot in Oxfordshire, stopping along the way to view a structure designed by Isambard Kingdom Brunel in Maidenhead. He also tries to collect the mail in the manner of Victorian postal workers on a steam-powered travelling post office

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through Hampshire and Berkshire, as he continues his journey to Wolverhampton. His stop-off points include Stratfield Saye House, the stately home bequeathed by the nation to Arthur Wellesley, 1st Duke of Wellington, in 1817. He then heads to Aldershot Garrison, where he is put through his paces under military instruction. At St Michael's Abbey in Farnborough, Michael visits the tomb of French emperor Napoleon III and his family, before ending in Crowthorne, Berkshire, the home of Broadmoor high-security psychiatric hospital

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: The next part of Michael Portillo's journey from Southampton to Wolverhampton begins in Wokingham, Berkshire, where the former politician finds out how demand from a growing number of rail commuters fuelled the development of the modern printing press. He then learns about a Tudor businessman who manufactured cloth in enormous volumes in Newbury, and ends this leg of his trip in Bradford on Avon, Wiltshire. Here, a local manufacturer describes how his Victorian forebears were the first in Britain to be licensed to vulcanise rubber

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson examines the history of Lindisfarne, which lies off the Northumberland coast. From what became known as the Holy Island of Lindisfarne, monks spread Christianity to the rest of northern England and created one of Britain's finest treasures - the Lindisfarne Gospels. programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: SAS: Who Dares Wins
programme.desc: The remaining recruits are ambushed and handed over to interrogators for questioning. They must endure psychological and physical punishments designed to break their will while sticking to their cover story. The end is near but will the final seven prove magnificent or not?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.desc: Wayne Sleep hosts a Moulin Rouge-themed party, and while actor Bobby Davro arrives in a dress, former Apprentice contestant Raef Bjayou is forced to participate in a can-can. programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Entrepreneur and former Apprentice contestant Raef Bjayou hosts the third party, but faces a mad dash to find a house in which to hold the meal, as well as silk nightwear for his pyjama dress code. Lesley Joseph is unimpressed when he serves undercooked meat, and Bobby Davro gets up to his old tricks in a giraffe costume

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Socialite Tamara Beckwith hosts the fourth dinner party and is determined to have an impressive cake thanks to her Italian mother-in-law's ancient recipes. She also tries to woo her guests by creating a Rat Pack atmosphere, including a Dean Martin lookalike serving the cocktails

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Actress Lesley Joseph hosts the final dinner party of the week, and tries to impress her diners with a Titanic-themed evening, complete with a chamber orchestra. However, they are left bemused when she begins blow-drying her duck, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

They have chosen the Loire Valley as their perfect location because of its landscapes, rivers, historic chateaux and wonderful food. Scarlette Douglas sets out to help them find a property on a budget of £73,000.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The competition comes from in and around Brighton. The first host, 47-year-old radio presenter Guy, plans a musical evening with a Mexican menu and an air guitar competition. His guests are 26-year-old recruitment company director Emma, 28-year-old pilot Tim, 38-year-old personal trainer Hannah and 50-year-old 'love doctor' Monti. Guy hosts a hilarious evening with lessons in love, surprising revelations and a dessert that doesn't go to plan

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the second day in and around Brighton, and bubbly 26-year-old Emma is hosting a beach-themed dinner party in the hope of winning the £1,000 cash prize. After a day of forgotten ingredients and culinary calamities, Emma has some questions up her sleeve to help her find out more about 'love doctor' Monti. Dutch pilot Tim is also feeling the love, as a bromance begins to blossom

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The competition continues in and around Brighton, as Dutch pilot Tim draws on his travel experience to produce an international menu. After a turbulence-free day in the kitchen, Tim continues to charm his guests, especially DJ Guy

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Personal trainer Hannah reveals quite a lot more about herself to her guests. There are no shortage of shocks and surprises as layer after saucy layer is peeled away from the usually quiet and reserved host, but there's sauciness of a different kind when one guest annoys the others by defiantly adding their own condiments to each of the three courses

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The final night of competition in and around Brighton, sees 50-year-old 'love doctor' Monti try to cast his spell over his guests in an attempt to win the £1000 cash prize. While Monti tries to spread the love, Tim really puts his foot in it as his compliment to Hannah gets well and truly lost in translation

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Ben Hillman helps couple Whitney and Rose to find a holiday home around La Zenia on the Costa Blanca on a budget of £80,000

programme.title: Sarah Beeny's New Life in the Country
programme.desc: The family tackle five en-suite bathrooms, one for Graham and Sarah, and one each for the boys. They begin by installing under-floor hearing then take delivery of 178 different items required to kit out these separate rooms. When it comes to the tiling, Charlie and Raffey decide they want to do it themselves, so Sarah shows them her grouting skills. Things gets more tricky, however, when they try to shift a 400lb cast iron bathtub upstairs. Away from the build, the family learn about weaving rush seats and haymaking

programme.title: World's Most Secret Hotels
programme.desc: More hidden hotels are revealed in Uruguay, Sweden, Scotland, Oman and The Netherlands - from a camouflaged resort perched on the edge of a mountain, to mainland Britain's most isolated hotel

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie and Phil return to Edinburgh to visit Gary and Bill, after meeting them in 2020 to help them choose between to selling or renovating their house, to see what they decided. While Gary was packed and ready to move out of their four-bed Victorian cemetery lodge, Bill loved the unique features of their home and so the pair enlisted Kirstie and Phil's help

programme.title: Guy Martin's Great British Power Trip
programme.desc: Guy Martin visits the most important place in the entire national grid - the central control room - where electricity is bought, sold and routed every single second of the day. Temporarily tasked with the challenging job of keeping the country's lights on, Guy spends thousands of pounds in just a few minutes balancing the electricity supply-and-demand market, before his attention turns to the rise of renewable energy. He works with the army, who are pioneering a new solar-powered workshop, before embarking on the gruelling training required to become an off-shore wind farm technician

programme.title: The Italian Job (2003)
programme.desc: A crook double-crosses his partners in crime, a betrayal that leaves their friend and mentor dead. One year later, they regroup and come up with a daring plan to exact revenge on the traitor and reclaim their ill-gotten gains. Crime thriller inspired by the 1969 movie, starring Mark Wahlberg, Charlize Theron, Edward Norton, Seth Green and Donald Sutherland

programme.title: In the Footsteps of Killers
programme.desc: Emilia Fox and criminologist David Wilson investigate the disappearance of 13-year-old David Spencer and 11-year-old Patrick Warren, who went missing in Birmingham on Boxing Day in 1996. To this day, no one has been charged with the double disappearance and murder of the two friends, and their bodies have never been found despite two major police investigations and a missing persons campaign that featured the boys' pictures on milk cartons. But now, Emilia and David discover new evidence leading to a prime suspect

programme.title: In the Footsteps of Killers
programme.desc: In June 1990, 52-year-old grandmother Trevaline Evans closed her antique shop in Llangollen, north Wales, for a few moments, leaving behind a note that suggested she would be back shortly. She never returned, having apparently vanished into thin air. Presenter Emilia Fox, leading criminologist Professor David Wilson and former senior detective Dr Graham Hill investigate the circumstances surrounding Trevaline's disappearance and identify several new suspects

programme.title: The Supervet

Noel meets the animals threatened by poaching, injured due to neglect in captivity, and exploited in one way or another. programme.title: Police Interceptors

programme.title: Police Interceptors

programme.title: Police Interceptors

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: As the hunt for La Grenouille intensifies, Tony's cover is blown and his car is later destroyed in an explosion, leaving the team convinced he has been killed. However, Ducky's autopsy on the body of the driver reveals it was actually someone else who died in the blast

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The agents are called to the scene of a car accident in which a petty officer was killed. They discover a bullet wound in the body, as well as another victim at the bottom of a nearby ravine - a woman who was beaten to death. Ducky conducts an autopsy and makes a discovery that sets the agents off in search of a missing infant. Meanwhile, Tony is distracted by developments in his relationship with Jeanne

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Lt Col Mann arrives to assist with inquiries into the murder of a marine - a case that becomes personal for Gibbs when he learns one of the witnesses is his ex-wife Stephanie. The team discovers the prime suspect was having an affair with the dead man's spouse, but the case is complicated by the revelation that the victim may have been selling top-secret military information. Starring Mark Harmon

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A woman is discovered in a bathroom next to the battered corpse of her boyfriend's brother, and immediately becomes the prime suspect in his murder. However, the discovery she is a pre-op transsexual leaves the team with new questions to consider. Drama, starring Christopher Meloni, Mariska Hargitay and Dann Florek

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A serial rapist represents himself in court and is released on bail, despite his first victim picking him out during an identity parade. Benson and Stabler refuse to give up the chase, but the criminal strikes again, and this time the result is murder. Fred Savage guest stars alongside Christopher Meloni and Mariska Hargitay

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The decomposing body of a five-year-old girl is found, leading to the revelation that a homicidal paedophile is on the loose. The subsequent disappearance of a second youngster leads to a race against time to save her from a similar fate. Gritty drama, starring Christopher Meloni, Mariska Hargitay and Dann Florek

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The rape of a woman in a coma leads the team to question a doctor whose stem cell research is funded by a billionaire with Parkinson's disease. They discover the tycoon is working in tandem with the medic to find a cure, but the pair's unethical procedures eventually come under scrutiny in court. Christopher Meloni and Mariska Hargitay star

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: Broadway star Marc Landry falls to his death after his flying harness fails during a performance of a play based on the Greek myth of Icarus. Goren and Eames are called in when it becomes clear the rigging had been tampered with, and the detectives talk to director Amanda Rollins about the significance of a bouquet of flowers with peacock feathers delivered to the victim. Goren also pays a visit to old friend and mythology lecturer Cleo Andrews for expert advice. Guest starring Cynthia Nixon and Patti Smith

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: In the last-ever episode of the long-running crime drama, twins Parker and Thomas Gaffney are found dead in the offices of a successful internet dating website. It emerges they believed the company's owner Danielle Magee had stolen their business idea after they employed her as a programmer and had filed a lawsuit against her. Goren attends his final therapy session and finds his future in the force is in question. Vincent D'Onofrio stars

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. The programme reveals how essential surveillance cameras have become in the fight against crime and features footage of people caught red-handed

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong

With Scott Bakula and Lucas Black

programme.title: Ross Kemp: Extreme World
programme.desc: Ross stays close to home for the final film, investigating how British seaside towns have been affected by the boom in cheap foreign holidays. Once celebrated, coastal resorts are now in the grip of once unimaginable levels of social decline. Many have become unemployment black spots, while former hotels and guest houses are being used to home the country's most vulnerable residents. Ross visits the worst affected areas to investigate the realities behind their tragic decline, and to find out what can be done to revive their fortunes

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Brody is assigned to the security detail for the Vice Chief of Naval Operations. However, when the group arrives at its destination, a sniper fires. The admiral is saved, but fellow agent Austin Hackett dies. While Pride and his team try to find the shooter, security team leader Ryan Anson places Brody under investigation, questioning her competence. Meanwhile, Lund recreates the shooting and comes to the realisation that Hackett did not give his life to save the admiral - because he was never the target

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. programme.desc: Koenig and the Moonbase Alpha crew find themselves at war with an unnamed planet - and the hostilities have a disastrous outcome. Martin Landau stars

programme.title: The Baron
programme.desc: Cordelia travels to South America on Mannering's behalf to meet an explorer who has something to tell them

programme.title: Revolution in Colour
programme.desc: Part one of a two part documentary exploring the struggle for Irish independence in the early 20th century. Professor Eunan O'Halpin examines the years leading up to the 1918 British general election, which saw a rise in radicalisation among both Nationalists and Unionists

programme.title: Coastal Railways with Julie Walters
programme.desc: The actress travels from Newcastle to Edinburgh by high speed train. Along the way, she stops off at the coastal town of Alnmouth, discovers where the phrase Keep Calm and Carry On originated, visits the world's biggest gannet colony, and goes out to sea with a lobster breeder. When she reaches her destination, she discovers the connection between the railway and the famous Balmoral Hotel

programme.title: Gypsy Girl (1965)
programme.desc: With Hayley Mills. A young, lonely, emotionally challenged teenage girl finds solace in burying dead animals after the sudden traumatic death of a childhood friend ten years earlier

programme.title: Up in the World (1956)
programme.desc: A bumbling window cleaner is elated to land a job at an aristocrat's country house. However, the spoilt young heir to the estate likes to play pranks on him - and lands the hapless servant in very hot water after the pair make a trip to a nightclub together and walk straight into a kidnap plot. Comedy, starring Norman Wisdom, Michael Caridia, Maureen Swanson and Jerry Desmonde

programme.title: Cat Hospital
programme.desc: A look inside Ireland's first purpose-built clinic that caters exclusively for cats, nestled in the leafy environs of Glanmire outside Cork city. In this first episode, veterinary surgeon Clare Meade and her team meet the families of the cats they treat to try to understand their ailments. Biker Wolfgang worries that Paulina, the newest arrival to his feline family of 25, is having extreme difficulty breathing, Clare diagnoses a large growth in Paulina's throat and it looks like she will need to operate

programme.title: Danger Dogs
programme.desc: Documentary following dogs and their trainers as they are put through their paces in everything from sniffing out drugs to finding roadside bombs in conflict zones

programme.title: A Shock to the System (1990)
programme.desc: A frustrated executive accidentally pushes a homeless man into the path of a subway train. Realising he has got away with one killing, he begins to wonder how many more murders he can pull off - starting with his rivals at work, his nagging wife and anyone else who has ever caused him misery. Black comedy, starring Michael Caine, Elizabeth McGovern, Peter Riegert and Swoosie Kurtz

programme.title: Haraam (2018)
programme.desc: A man tries to pluck up the courage to profess his love to a departing co-worker of a very different cultural, ethnic and religious background before she leaves on her last day of work. Drama, starring Ainy Jaffri and Cherno Jagne

programme.title: Small City (2021)
programme.desc: A young street hustler from London and a drugs mule from Europe form an unlikely bond after a violent confrontation with a neighbourhood heavy. Thriller, starring Eddie Thompson

programme.desc: A famous writer and academic living off the reputation of his single novel resorts to shoplifting to introduce some excitement to his stable life. He is caught in the act by a lonely, unbalanced security guard, who has an unusual price for his silence - he wants them to be friends, and goes to disturbing lengths to force himself into the author's life. Thriller, starring Stephen Graham, Conleth Hill and Lara Pulver

Thriller, starring Paddy Considine and Aiysha Hart
